  freestar.config = freestar.config || {};

        <div class="grid-container" id="main-content">
                            <div class="grid-x grid-margin-x">
    <div class="small-12 medium-12 large-9 cell">

        <div class="grid-x bg-white grid-padding-x grid-padding-y" style="width: 100%; position: relative;" itemtype="http://schema.org/Product" itemscope><div class="cell small-12" id="toptop"><h1                             <div class="num-votes-sp"><span style="font-size: 0.8rem;">38</span></div>
                        </div>
                    </div>
                    </div>
                    Sweaty vetiver and green notes in the drydown

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2371176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eliabra222"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2335095"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eliabra222" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Santal-33-12201.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12201.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal 33"title="Santal 33"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2371176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2371176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2335095">eliabra222</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-12-04"></span><fromunixtime unixtime="1733365274" class="vote-button-legend"></fromunixtime></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I found the initial spray of this perfume to be a super nauseatingly overpowering white floral that sat very heavy on the skin. However, after giving the fragrance about 45 minutes, on drydown it began to smell more like a light musky white floral that sat a little close to the wearer's skin in a "your skin but better" way. However, I still don't think this is a groundbreaking or special white floral and certainly not one that warrants Le Labo's high price tags.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; If I liked white florals, then this would be a must. Since I’m not a fan, then I will definitely pass on this. Great sillage and longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2357857"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2357857#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2321213" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2321213" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragfag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1674018.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragfag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2321213ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2321213" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674018">Fragfag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-19">10/19/24 17:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Le Labo Lys 41 is a pure creamy white floral, absolutely gorgeous. The batch I tested was compounded in June 2024 so it was fresh. There was nothing animalic at all. Just beautiful white floral. My only complaint is performance which I found to be weak.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2321213"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2321213#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2317534" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2317534"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2317534#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2303623" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2303623" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Coppersulfate"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898638"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1898638.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Coppersulfate" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Fleur-de-Peau-Eau-de-Parfum-48681.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48681.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"title="Fleur de Peau Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2303623ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2303623" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1898638">Coppersulfate</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-03">10/03/24 10:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very nice creamy and animalic tuberose. The lily is barely there sadly.. but i do enjoy this nonetheless. One of the creamiest non gourmand white florals out there. But i prefer photorealism, and this doesnt smell like a real tuberose/lily/jasmine/any flower. So i could never give it a 10. At this price point you might as well get carnal flower and be amazed at what it will offer you. <br />
<br />
That aside, its very sunny and summery, even though the vanilla is present. Its not cloying or sweet. I could see a beautiful and calm girl rocking this as her signature fragrance. It doesnt go ‘grandma’ (which i prefer) even though the notes would make u believe so. Okay performance, its rather lowkey but it develops really nicely. It becomes creamier as time passes. All in all, i’d give it a 7 simply because its nothing to write home about. Its good and definitely a safe blind buy, but it will never impress somebody who’s into animalic white florals</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2303623"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2303623#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0; border: none; margin: 0;"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_incontent_6 -->

Lasts. Powerful but not overpowering.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2298442"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2298442#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2298198" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2298198" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lazulisylph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1883751"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1883751.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lazulisylph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Lilyphea-96740.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96740.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilyphéa"title="Lilyphéa"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2298198ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2298198" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1883751">lazulisylph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-28">09/28/24 13:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>White florals can be very polarising in fragrances but I personally think Lys 41 is quite mass-appealing for a white floral perfume because of its vanilla and woody notes. On me, the white florals fade almost completely into the background in a short amount of time and becomes a scent that is reminiscent of sunscreen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2298198"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2298198#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2293224" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2293224" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Denisa Aiko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1827055"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1827055.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Denisa Aiko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Bal-d-Afrique-6458.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6458.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bal d'Afrique"title="Bal d'Afrique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2293224ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2293224" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1827055">Denisa Aiko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-24">09/24/24 00:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I sampled this fragrance and.. I mean …it’s just straight up white flower bouquet. <br />
It reminds you of the feeling when you enter the flower shop. <br />
Nothing special about it ,there’s no twist ,just white flowers.<br />
 Smells too natural and simple for this price point. Maybe the “natural scent ” is the whole concept of this house, but I still can’t justify the price for this simple fragrance.<br />
And maybe LE LABO is not my thing.<br />
 I’ve tried all of their fragrances and none of them impressed me.<br />
Not to mention that santal 33 was horrible.<br />
This one is nice compared to others, but still not it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2293224"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2293224#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2291317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I wouldnt want to smell like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2284120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2284120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2273786" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2273786" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mel_Nocturnum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/382354"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.382354.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mel_Nocturnum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Missoni/Aria-Missoni-3249.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3249.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aria Missoni"title="Aria Missoni"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2273786ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2273786" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/382354">Mel_Nocturnum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-06">09/06/24 11:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Le Labo fragrances are known for naming a fragrance one way and having it smell like another. Lys 41; a richly custard creamed vanilla with heady tuberose that doesn’t smell like lily most days. On hot ones though, it brings forth a hazy dreamscape of alien lilies that smell richly saturated and narcotic. On very hot days, I can smell a Polaroid Anaïs Anaïs as if she’s carried in the arms of The Terminator towards salvation. Today is a very hot day. It all feels right again!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2273786"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2273786#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2258268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2258268" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarxoxo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201186"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarxoxo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2258268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2258268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1201186">sarxoxo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-23">08/23/24 06:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not my fav scent profile throughout the year, but it’s divine when going on a summer vacation. <br />
<br />
Whenever I go to tropical destinations I love heady florals, they shine in the heat radiating off your skin. <br />
<br />
This smells like someone laying at the beach on the hot sand, tanning with the most luxurious oil. Drenched in it !<br />
I was debating between this and La Mar by house of Bo. They’re similar but this lasts longer. <br />
<br />
The feeling this gives you after u were at the beach going back to ur 5 star resort is unbeatable. An olfactive souvenir.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2258268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2258268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2257870" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2257870" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smellad"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076842"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2076842.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smellad" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2257870ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2257870" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076842">smellad</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-22">08/22/24 18:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love Le Labo, and I have quiet a collection. My favorite was Matcha 26 and Fleur de Oranger.... until i blindly bought this one. I am surprised how much i love this fragrance!! I had always get compliments. This is so beautifully done, and I cant get over it. Jasmin 17 is also a love for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2257870"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2257870#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2256942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2256942" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="specialfairygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112296"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1112296.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="specialfairygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-for-Her-38497.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38497.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus for Her"title="Aventus for Her"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2256942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2256942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112296">specialfairygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-22">08/22/24 00:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No doubt Lys 41 is a likeable fragrance. I personally however find it too strong, too white floral, a bit too much. If you like straightforward white flower scents this might be for you. Pretty, but not very interesting in my opinion and it does have an old school quality about it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2256942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2256942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2253899" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Thanks to Le Labo, the great mixing leads the white florals to a fresh feminine path instead of a heady bubblegumy one. padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112296">specialfairygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-11">08/11/24 03:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pleasant, but.. It's very strong, very white floral, not bad, however the downside of it is its strength (a bit loud) and its non depth. Just stays the same and then it slowly evaporates. If you like surprises in a fragrance this will not deliver. I also wonder where to wear it, it's a bit too loud in the office, not really an evening scent, not really a daytime one either. Probably if you live in a a warm climate and you need something to mask perspiration, this will do it. Very female and also a bit old school. Pleasant and quite nice though, but I expected more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2245631"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2245631#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2241965" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; But im getting over her ,,,</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2238960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2238960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2234339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2234339" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="1annie.beth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862342"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1862342.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="1annie.beth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Rosie-Jane/Rosie-52177.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52177.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosie"title="Rosie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2234339ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2234339" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1862342">1annie.beth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-30">07/30/24 22:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the sexiest tuberose I have ever smelled! Opens with heady, very realistic white florals. The vanilla, woods, and musks ground the flowers in a creamy warmth that deepens as it dries down. In fact, it's probably the only fragrance I've ever tried that only gets better and better as it dries down. It turns very animalic on my skin but it's sultry, not skanky. It makes me feel so beautiful and feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2234339"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2234339#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2220695" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2220695" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mariel_vela"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2186041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mariel_vela" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2220695ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2220695" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2186041">mariel_vela</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-16">07/16/24 18:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this one on my first visit to L.A. I remember drifting through the city getting surnbunt, feeling the asphalt hot and radiant. That is until I would get a sweet breeze coming from a jasmines planted next to the sidewalk. I would wear it stoned and wander in my bungalow in a nightgown like a hot, rotting city flower. This one is absolute romance to me, I adore it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2220695"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2220695#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2209705" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2209705" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cheleine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1349744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cheleine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2209705ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2209705" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1349744">cheleine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-06">07/06/24 02:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I see the comparisons to Carnal Flower and Do Son and I think they’re only there because of the tuberose note.<br />
This is a different scent though. <br />
On my skin, it’s quite smoother and sweeter, your can definitely feel the vanilla and musk enveloping the whole composition, making everything easy, pleasant, with no harshness. I can feel that lovely lily note that doesn’t smell like a funeral lily (phew!) but is very crisp and elegant. I can also smell a little bit of beachy ylang ylang, although I don’t see it in the notes above. <br />
If there’s jasmine, it’s blended impeccably with the rest of the notes and is not indolic in the slightest.<br />
Overall a lovely spring-summer scent that could work for everyday, formal occasions and even a bridal scent as it feels very pure.<br />
<br />
Edit: I found this quite similar in scent profile to Love Tuberose by Amouage!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2209705"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2209705#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2206420" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2206420" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nerolyan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204894"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1204894.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nerolyan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Blackberry-Bay-15134.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15134.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blackberry & Bay"title="Blackberry & Bay"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2206420ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2206420" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204894">nerolyan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-02">07/02/24 19:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Funnily enough, I came here to write a review on this gorgeous fragrance and the review right before mine says pretty much everything I was going to say. I'm also a guy, I purchased Le Labo's sample set and even though I can't see myself wear Lys 41 out in public because of how feminine I perceive it, I find it absolutely addictive! Probably my favorite of the whole set along with Fleur d'oranger 27.<br />
<br />
This is a great example of fragrances being a form of art that can be appreciated by anybody. It might not be used sprayed on as an expression of gender, like most perfumes are meant to, but I can enjoy this by myself at home and it's just as much worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2206420"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2206420#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2200621" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2200621" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jacquesbyrne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1873006.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jacquesbyrne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2200621ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2200621" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873006">jacquesbyrne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-26">06/26/24 21:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Disclaimer: I am a man. <br />
<br />
Although, after initially testing it in the morning, I would not wear this as my scent of the day (it doesn’t quite convey the image I want to project to the world), I have been spritzing it on the inside of my elbows before going to bed—and let me tell you: I have been having the best dreams. Take that as you will. <br />
<br />
If Do Son is a beautifully lit/composed photograph of white flowers, Lys 41 is a shiny pop song about white flowers. @foldyrhands described this as “bratty” on Twitter, and I love that. You can almost smell this fragrance rolling its eyes. <br />
<br />
There is a definite sunscreen accord I’m getting. This is something that’d be great to wear in a bikini. And the vanilla is more ‘realistic’ than gourmand (think DS &amp; Durga’s deep dark vanilla), but it is definitely a supporting character to the sharp and sun-baked tuberose and lily. <br />
<br />
I put this on after taking my nightly shower with Native’s lilac &amp; white tea body wash, and this compliments it very well. This might shock you, but I swear I’m straight.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2200621"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2200621#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2197598" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2197598" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheEclecticNose"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591466"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1591466.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheEclecticNose" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2197598ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2197598" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1591466">TheEclecticNose</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-23">06/23/24 20:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am not sure why my nose doesn't love Tuberose, despite me owning extremely expensive Tuberose fragrances. Something about Tuberose makes me feel like the vibe I'm radiating is wedding day ready, beachside, sun tanned legs and white outfit, happy to be alive and ready for the male suitors - which makes me want to wash the fragrance right off. The vibe is great but the actual scent of Tuberose can be really overwhelming, whether it's a tropical or screechy direction. HOW AND EVER. Lys 41 is gooood. It's not screechy, it's not tropical, it's not a full on flower Tuberose core to the nostril. It smells like the Tuberose you want to emulate. It reminds me of a white couch with soft yellow and blue floral patterned wall paper in a traditional home in Cape Cod. It's giving the tuberose floral note, the heavy cream, and yellowness that tuberose captures without being a punch to the nose or to the prefrontal cortex, or one that makes you queasy or signal to your stomach that you're hungry, because sometimes fragrances overwhelm the nose that your body tries to overcompensate with distractions to other cues. This will last and project throughout the entire day no question. I find that this Tuberose is one that you can wear year round since it doesn't have a particular direction, however the one down side about tuberose to me is that it forces you to have a sunny disposition which may contrast your normal aptitude for neutrality. This is why these types of scents are difficult to wear because your personality and the personality of the fragrance may be at odds, which makes it a niche fragrance. This is not the unique fragrance from the house that people will talk about, or the point of delving into niche fragrances for a fragrance like this, however what is niche is doing a scent so perfect without any contaminants of other disturbing notes that you may find in designer fragrances, and for that - this unfiltered and unapologetic tuberose is full bottle worthy. Just be prepared to smile even if you're dead inside when you're wearing this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2197598"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2197598#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2194180" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2194180" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bellalandia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2091211.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="bellalandia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Regime-des-Fleurs/Himitsu-72664.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72664.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Himitsu"title="Himitsu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2194180ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2194180" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2091211">bellalandia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-20">06/20/24 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought the tester from LeLabos website and have worn it. Its very heavy on white florals. Very spicy and strong florals with edge. Smell is strong and both in intensity and longevity. I dont smell tropical flowers and I dont find this perfume tropical at all. It gives vintage vibes, something like your granny was wearing in her little dusty house filled with fresh cut lilies. The drydown is delicious though, as i find it comforting and creamy. It smells like the creamiest vanilla musk, very strange. I find the drydown amazing and I wish the whole perfume smelled like that. Its crazy how aggresive and strong and violent is LYS at first, and then it transforms itself into beautiful butterly. I really appritiate the craftsmanship of LeLabo as I am new to this brand. I think this perfume has the best longevity and intensity of all their fragrances. So If you like aggresive white florals that melt after 2 h into comforting, sweet hug- this is for you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2194180"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2194180#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2189680" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2189680" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WhiteFlowerPrincess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1662712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WhiteFlowerPrincess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Lucky-48385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lucky"title="Lucky"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2189680ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2189680" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1662712">WhiteFlowerPrincess</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 23:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is like Carnal Flower Lite to me, like others here have said already. Thankfully it doesn't have most of Carnal Flower's very bitter camphor and menthol notes or its mothball quality. Carnal Flower's eucalyptus note gives me a rash and gives me a headache, but this doesn't.<br />
<br />
I really wish that I could smell more lily in this though, since you don't find very many lily-centric perfunes out in the wild. I only get the faintest hint of lily and I mostly just get the jasmine and tuberose, with a drydown of sandalwood at the end. I'd say on that note that this is probably up there with the most realistic tuberose perfumes that I have ever smelt, 2nd behind Narcotic Venus by Nasomatto.<br />
<br />
I got moderate sillage and a fairly long wear of 9 hours on my skin from this fragrance, so I think that it is definitely worth what Le Labo are charging for it. I am undecided whether or not it is a 7.5 out of 10 (just shy of me wanting to buy it) or an 8 out of 10 (where I pull the trigger) though. I think that I need more tries with it, since Carnal Flower wasn't my favorite scent and I am worried that this smells too much like it. Narcotic Venus is definitely a winner for me though!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2189680"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2189680#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2179986" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2179986" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="asiarakk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305265"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1305265.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="asiarakk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2179986ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2179986" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1305265">asiarakk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-06">06/06/24 09:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pleasant perfume, tuberose heavy. Yes, it’s gives a little bit of a sunscreen after 2h on my skin. Reminds me of Carnal Flowers by FM but without bitter notes. I prefer Carnal Flowers over this. Overpriced for what it is, but still very pleasant. Can be your wedding scent or wedding quest scent, unisex, best for 35yo+, spring-summer.<br />
Longevity is superb, I can smell it on clothes and hair for 2-3 days, 2 days on skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2179986"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2179986#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2172336" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2172336" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lisaw3122"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2150557"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lisaw3122" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Lira-11801.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11801.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lira"title="Lira"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2172336ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2172336" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2150557">lisaw3122</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-30">05/30/24 08:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this perfume soooo much but am tragically allergic to it. Makes me very itchy and break out in hives for days. Regardless of this it smells so good I suck it up and wear it anyways sometimes. No one else in my family has this reaction so I would def recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2172336"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2172336#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2170995" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2170995" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alfienumeric"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2124823"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2124823.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alfienumeric" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-43871.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43871.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina"title="Delina"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2170995ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2170995" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2124823">alfienumeric</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 23:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>They managed to bottle the scents of blooming night jasmine and pikake from tropical islands. This jasmine fragrance is feminine, lively, bright, sweet and playful but solid enough to match the sexiness of tanned shoulders, sundresses and bikinis but can be worn on summer nights with a strapless floral dress with open toe heels.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex;
