padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2164690" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jjx"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1419831"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1419831.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jjx" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Myrrh-Tonka-42027.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.42027.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrh & Tonka"title="Myrrh & Tonka"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2164690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2164690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1419831">jjx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 17:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the scent I always gate-keep. People will ask me what I’m wearing and I will just say Le Labo, and wont tell them which scent. The perfect mixture of white florals and warm musk. Reminds me of a woman is very powerful yet never raises her voice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2164690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2164690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2153325" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2153325" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ajlis"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2074474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ajlis" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2153325ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2153325" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2074474">Ajlis</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-12">05/12/24 00:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A tropical, floral sunscreen scent. Lys 41 is very sweet, much sweeter than my favourite tuberose fragrance, Diptyque's Do Son. While Do Son is a green, indolic and realistic take on tuberose, Lys 41 has a sticky sweetness to it, that reminds me of marshmallows. Maybe that's why this perfume brings Killian's Love Don't Be Shy to mind. This is a happy and carefree scent that would go well with a sundress and sunglasses on a beach vacation. A lovely summer scent, but not a must-have for me. I love Do Son passionately, and I just don't need another tuberose fragrance in my life.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2153325"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2153325#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2153226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2153226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CyanM"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2088532"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2088532.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CyanM" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-28-52616.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52616.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla 28"title="Vanilla 28"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2153226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2153226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2088532">CyanM</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-11">05/11/24 21:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had tried Santal 33 and Tonka 25, and neither was for me. This has renewed my interest in Le Labo. That said, I'm not usually a white florals lover, and although this perfume is exquisite, it's not the one that will win me over. The opening is really interesting, after which it's a flower bomb with a musky, woody base—lovely, with good projection and longevity. I respect this perfume, but it's not for me to wear. If these notes are your thing, I hope you love it!<br />
<br />
Over time: The first hit is a too-strong blast of indistinguishable-to-me florals, with something a little sharp and green threaded through. After fifteen minutes it has settled and it's creamier and smoother, but still a bouquet, and still something more pungent at the center. At forty-five, that pungent note is gone and it has settled into the expected white florals—tuberose, then jasmine. Two hours in, I still smell tuberose, but the musk and wood are definitely making themselves known. At three hours I finally detect vanilla. From there it stays vanillic and slightly musky, but fainter and fainter.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2153226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2153226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2149108" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2149108" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dandelionsandfire"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2004082"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2004082.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dandelionsandfire" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Oriana-69117.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69117.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oriana"title="Oriana"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2149108ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2149108" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2004082">dandelionsandfire</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-07">05/07/24 23:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I loved the opening because it reminds me of frangipani, but sadly it turns into waxy sunscreen and slight playdoh.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2149108"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2149108#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2136055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2136055" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lindenberg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319565"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1319565.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lindenberg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Fleur-d-Oranger-27-6331.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6331.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur d'Oranger 27"title="Fleur d'Oranger 27"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2136055ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2136055" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1319565">lindenberg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-25">04/25/24 10:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Some truly strange reviews of this one here. This perfume is absolutely exquisite.<br />
<br />
As a lover of jasmine, sandalwood, and creamy notes juxtaposed with sharpness, this is a pleasant new discovery for me. It opens quite sharp, with an overwhelming jasmine note, and it dries down to more of a creamy tuberose scent. <br />
<br />
I just might have found a good replacement for J'adore Touche de Parfum, my favorite perfume that's been discontinued. It's missing some notes, like hibiscus, rose and sandalwood to be the perfect dupe for Touche de Parfum, but still a happy replacement.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2136055"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2136055#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2130260" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2130260" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Magicalworldofhannah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919948"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1919948.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Magicalworldofhannah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2130260ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2130260" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1919948">Magicalworldofhannah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-20">04/20/24 03:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Stunning. White florals. Not heavy or grandma vibes. Modern. Feminine. Heaps of jasmine. It's just beautiful! For me I mostly smell jasmine, I can tell there's other white florals but the jasmine sticks out for me and I love that. It's super clean, light, not sure about lasting power as I only smelt this as the store. But I love it 10/10 and will be purchasing</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2130260"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2130260#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2119181" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2119181" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TheFragranceGirlie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/321022"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="TheFragranceGirlie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Eyes-Closed-76339.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76339.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eyes Closed"title="Eyes Closed"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2119181ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2119181" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/321022">TheFragranceGirlie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-09">04/09/24 07:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I would HIGHLY advise sampling this before purchasing! This sample is available for about $7.50, along with the other Le Labo samples, on their website. As soon as I sprayed this, I was knocked to my feet by the repulsive, old lady smell. Although it might not be listed, there is DEFINITELY hints of Ylang Ylang in this fragrance. LOL Please ignore the Tiktok raving reviews about this fragrance and order a sample FIRST! - 0/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2119181"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2119181#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2112547" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2112547" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="coconutbeth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027821"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2027821.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="coconutbeth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Liquides-Imaginaires/Blanche-Bete-70189.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70189.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blanche Bête"title="Blanche Bête"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2112547ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2112547" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2027821">coconutbeth</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-02">04/02/24 23:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Poolside perfection. Go to summer scent!<br />
<br />
Update : This has really surprised me. I've had it a little over a year and a half and I knew I loved it but wouldn't have called it my signature scent. That being said, I ran out of it faster than any of my other scents. I crave it and think about it all the time and so does my husband. He has never 'requested' a scent but every time I can't decide what to wear he votes Lys. <br />
<br />
I don't know what it is about this fragrance but it always just makes me happy and puts me  in a good mood. I can't have a bad time if I'm wearing Lys, it's impossible. <br />
<br />
During the summer months this leans creamy coconut-y and sunscreen, especially in the Texas heat. But now that it's (finally) cool in Texas ALL I smell is Tuberose and it is LOVELY! I was devastated to put this away for the year but it seems I won't have to as it has evolved with the weather bringing something entirely new. I'm surprised to say, this is a year round beauty.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2112547"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2112547#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2108467" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076924">sleepiestgirlinthevalley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 15:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>this makes me mad bc for the first like 45 mins it’s too beachy floral on me and its not a smell i want to be associated with <br />

align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2108225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2108225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2086482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2086482" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jordan 99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647482"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1647482.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jordan 99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2086482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2086482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647482">Jordan 99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-08">03/08/24 15:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opening is way too strong for me, but I love drydown. Tuberose is so pure, creamy and classy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2086482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2086482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2082686" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2082686" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RGH01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1331188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1331188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RGH01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Francesca-Bianchi/The-Dark-Side-40884.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40884.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Dark Side"title="The Dark Side"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2082686ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2082686" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1331188">RGH01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-05">03/05/24 02:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 is a fairly simplistic white floral scent, but it’s definitely one of the better tuberose fragrances I’ve come across. It’s focused around the pure white trio of tuberose, Lily and Jasmine which creates the most delicate and gentle scent profile.<br />
<br />
The tuberose in here isn’t thick, waxy or bubblegummy at all. It’s balanced perfectly by the airy, slightly green and vegetal nature of the lily and jasmine to avoid becoming cloying or overly sweet. There’s soft hints of gentle vanilla and soapy synthetic musks but overall the entire scent is revolved around these three flowers. <br />
<br />
I really enjoy this scent, although not enough to buy a bottle. It’s incredibly relaxing and meditative to wear, but for the price it is just too simple of a scent profile to justify it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2082686"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2082686#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2080889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2080889" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="crowbaby"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036007"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2036007.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="crowbaby" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2080889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2080889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036007">crowbaby</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 09:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i just so happened to pass by a brick and mortar le labo yesterday, and remembered seeing LYS on many different comments here. i'm sorry but... where is the vanilla? or the creaminess everyone is mentioning? this smelled like tuberose shower gel. there was no dimension whatsoever, which was a huge bummer. this, like all the other le labo fragrances, is too simple and "nothing" to be worth the price point. if you are rich and love the smell of various soaps, you'll love every fragrance by le labo. (a complete letdown that figue is their best scent but only available as a room spray. sigh!!!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2080889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2080889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073896" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073896" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DarckChild"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544451"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="DarckChild" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073896ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073896" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544451">DarckChild</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-25">02/25/24 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is Gucci Bloom with longevity and better projection. I loved Gucci Bloom but it didn't last more than 30 minutes on me. This is almost identical with the niche price tag, but is definitely worth it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2073896"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2073896#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2072913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2059194" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Naoelyse"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2011280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2011280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Naoelyse" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3575.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gypsy Water"title="Gypsy Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2059194ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2059194" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2011280">Naoelyse</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 12:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Dreamy, creamy white floral. Sexy and warm without being heavy. I love it for summertime and outfits with lots of skin. I've found it to be a compliment getter. I usually dislike vanilla frags, but the vanilla in Lys 41 is not overly sweet, nor gourmand. It has a subtle woody depth to it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2059194"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2059194#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2055766" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2055766"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2055766#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2047176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2047176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elclvna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1714454"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1714454.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elclvna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moth-and-Rabbit-Perfumes/Blow-Up-52812.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52812.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blow Up"title="Blow Up"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2047176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2047176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1714454">elclvna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-30">01/30/24 16:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>GOD. Actually getting teary-eyed at the prospect of reviewing this perfume but seeing as it's my absolute ride or die I feel as though I must. My mom wore La Chasse aux Papillons by L'Artisan Parfumeur when I was younger, and this scent reminds me of that one every time, even after years of wearing it. Tuberose is truly the goddess of all flowers. It's beautifully white and yellow and light and dark and nasty and sweet and harsh and totally chill like oh my God. Lys 41 smells like everything lovely and neutral and tragic about girlhood, like lying on your stomach on the floor kicking your feet in the air and writing in your diary while the breeze from the open window flutters the pages. Maybe you're writing about terrible things but the moment is calm and beautiful. Maybe you're still wearing somebody else's lipstick on your neck and wondering why you've never really liked roses, or a record is spinning on the turntable and you're sticky with the heat of dancing around the bedroom you've danced in your whole life. Not sure where I'm going with this. I love being a girl and I love my mom and I love tuberose. I love that there are so many ways to be a girl and to smell like a girl. Before I had a full sized bottle of this I would save my little sample to wear when I was going to see my girlfriend. I really love her a lot. There are so many things in this world that I love. Ok that's all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2047176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2047176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2046978" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2046978" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarp"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1993446"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1993446.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarp" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/MYSLF-Le-Parfum-94983.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.94983.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="MYSLF Le Parfum"title="MYSLF Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2046978ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2046978" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); When you have LYS 41 sitting there! This runs Santal 33 in any way possible.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2046978"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2046978#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2043730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2043730" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginandrice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1246357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginandrice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aesop/Hwyl-46895.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46895.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hwyl"title="Hwyl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2043730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2043730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357">ginandrice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-27">01/27/24 11:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A summery, skin-like white floral. It's creamy and a little woody, with subtle banana-orange undertones from the tuberose and jasmine.<br />
 <br />
Warm sun, banana bubblegum, and beached driftwood. Sensual but clean. <br />
<br />
A linen beach blanket, unfurled and shaken aloft. Pale gold sand shifting underfoot. A streak of sunscreen on a bare shoulder-blade. The glossy pages of a trashy magazine, peaking from the top of a beach tote. It's early July, and the whole Summer is just waiting to happen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2043730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2043730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2038508" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2038508" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smelling.sniffing.swan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1892188.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="smelling.sniffing.swan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2038508ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2038508" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1892188">smelling.sniffing.swan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-22">01/22/24 09:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Super pretty and fun.<br />
Potent jasmine and wet tuberose.<br />
<br />
Very sweet, maybe some pear? But, not offensively sweet.<br />
Kinda old-fashioned, musky, vanila base.<br />
<br />
Fairly simple and straightforward.<br />
Not a heap of complexity, which is ok, it fits with the innocent and fun profile this has.<br />
<br />
Quite potent, performance wise. And definitely leaning pretty feminine.<br />
<br />
Really reminds me of Curious by Britney Spears.<br />
Save yourself the financial heart-ache and just get that.<br />
<br />
VERDICT:<br />
Very nice, very pretty.<br />
But, the price is not justified.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2038508"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2038508#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033239" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033239" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="enthusmia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1824719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1824719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="enthusmia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-des-Ors/Rouge-Saray-60821.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.60821.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rouge Sarây"title="Rouge Sarây"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033239ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033239" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2019043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2019043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1988482" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1988482" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Owen Witabi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683830"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1683830.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Owen Witabi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1988482ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1988482" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683830">Owen Witabi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-29">11/29/23 16:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful white floral scent with incredible longevity. Sprayed this on my wife’s clothes and could still get big whiffs almost 12 hours later whenever I passed by her. All that’s left is tuberose but it’s a nice and airy tuberose, not cloying or overly powdery. Overall playful scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1988482"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1988482#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986961" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1986961" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rubycathryn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1795591"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1795591.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rubycathryn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1986961ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1986961" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1795591">rubycathryn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-27">11/27/23 22:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is lovely, a slightly masc (in the butch sense) floral which dries down to a sweaty animal note (I don't read any vanilla in this). Absolutely not for me, and if you, like me, prefer a cloudy / light / fairy-garden-esque jasmine, it's probably not for you either. Very post-workout, very sexy in the way a vintage loafer with a wool pant is sexy. I only wear it when I want to be taken seriously at board meetings.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1986961"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1986961#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985543" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1985543" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="guava jelly"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1666168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1666168.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="guava jelly" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1985543ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1985543" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1666168">guava jelly</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-26">11/26/23 04:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 billows about sumptuously, luxuriantly around its wearer; a huge bouquet of white lilies, immediately recognisable. This is a very photo-realistic composition to my nose. I get none of the vanilla nor the woody notes it proclaims to contain. Nor does it in any way connote anything at all close to sunscreen for me. Just white lilies through and through, from the very first spray to the very last aroma molecule that dries up and dissipates off my skin.<br />
<br />
I also have Diptyque’s Do Son, which has similar notes of tuberose and jasmine. They share DNA, to be sure, but where Do Son has a rich creaminess about it (almost bordering on oily for me, somehow), Lys 41 has a freshness and a clarity about it that lends to its sense of realism. I wholly agree with the reviewer who said this fragrance is very Hawai’i. It imparts a beautiful tropicality in the most natural and straightforward way. Where I currently live, June and July nights are redolent with the scents of grand crinum lillies, Easter lilies, and white angel’s trumpets wafting through the air near streams and coastlines. It’s magical, meditative, a wonderful respite from the oppressive heat of daytime. This fragrance smells just like those starlight-kissed nights. It finds perfect synergy with heat and humidity to create a salubrious bubble of refreshing beauty around its wearer. Compliments abound from people of all ages and genders.<br />
<br />
It is the end of November now, however, and I’ve just worn this for the first time outside of summer. To my slight dismay, but to hardly any surprise, it did not carry with it that same sense of resplendence. If you live somewhere hot and humid, Lys 41 is absolutely exquisite. If not, well—it may seem a bit more typical, a bit more pedestrian. Just goes to show how relative and context-specific our responses to smells are—and how fragrances respond to different atmospheric conditions as well, I suppose.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1985543"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1985543#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1960123" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1960123" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="correspondencepersonal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1060843"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1060843.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="correspondencepersonal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/My-Burberry-Black-32566.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32566.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="My Burberry Black"title="My Burberry Black"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1960123ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1960123" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1060843">correspondencepersonal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-10-24">10/24/23 20:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spritzed this today - this perfume has a tuberose and jasmine notes which is very pretty on.  This perfume is feminine, a softer blend of tuberose than I have tried before.  I will need to try this one again to catch the subtle nuances of it for a more informative review... this is definitely worth sampling...especially if you truly love florals and most especially, if you truly love tuberose.   This could be viewed as something possibly vintage, however - this particular blend is so well done that it doesn't immediately cause me to recognize this as a copy of anything that I have smelled before.  This is definitely a modern interpretation of jasmine and tuberose.  They did a very good job with this!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1960123"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1960123#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1953783" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; A delicious jasmine and tuberose. I think it's sweet feminine and sexy, but someone told me it made them nostalgic for their grandmother so read that how you will.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1700301">wowoweee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-22">08/22/23 15:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>warm white floral with vanilla. opening is very tuberose forward, reminds me of FM carnal flower. dry down adds a tropical/vanilla/sunscreen vibe that makes it smell a bit basic and cheap. very similar to YSL capeline. Lys 41 has surprisingly good longevity and sillage. leans pretty heavily feminine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1908864"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1908864#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1907877" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1907877" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AnnaMagenta"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572521"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1572521.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AnnaMagenta" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Rolling-in-Love-56402.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.56402.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rolling in Love"title="Rolling in Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1907877ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1907877" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572521">AnnaMagenta</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-21">08/21/23 13:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Despite majority voted this as a summer scent I prefer this for September. Cold air makes the opening less screechy and warm skin under coat opens the vanilla base to die for. Reminds me the time I was wearing it around the uni campus. <br />
That’s a tropical flowers smell but without coconut and  strong sunscreen vibe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1907877"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1907877#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904781" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1904781" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sabertooth_salem"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310673"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310673.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sabertooth_salem" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1904781ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1904781" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310673">sabertooth_salem</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 17:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I smell this, the brightest white comes to mind. Almost like flash blindness-- a bright white light overwhelming the retinas and a ringing in the ears that drowns out everything else. <br />
<br />
An indolic blast of musky tuberose and white florals under a scorching summer sun, a splash of Coppertone sunscreen from the skin of the person holding this luxurious bouquet. It's simple and rather elegant, yet chic. <br />
<br />
I could see a gorgeous woman wearing this with a skimpy satin dress on a sultry, summer night. Her skin is golden, glimmering, and hot to the touch, having lazed in the warm sun all day long. Yet it's unisex, becoming muskier and woodier as it settles. It would be irresistible on a well-dressed guy.<br />
<br />
Good lord, someone remind me to buy a full bottle of this for myself next summer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1904781"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1904781#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1902284" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1902284" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ihliciaru"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379275"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1379275.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ihliciaru" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Matcha-26-69731.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69731.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Matcha 26"title="The Matcha 26"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1902284ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1902284" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1379275">ihliciaru</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-14">08/14/23 17:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a bunch of testers from Le Labo, and chose this based on a recommendation from a Tiktoker. It reminds me of Tom Ford Jasmin Rouge, as it's a super-sweet sharp-white floral fragrance. Its a little too strong for my nose, but I found that layering it with Another 13 really grounds the scent on my skin. It's an expensive combo though lol so I donʻt think I will be purchasing a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1902284"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1902284#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1896004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Could be just my skin though...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1896004"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1896004#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1885064" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Is very classy elegant, spring on a bottle ❤️</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1885064"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1885064#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1876285" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1876285" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1876285ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1876285" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);
