Huge white florals but mixed with that suntan lotion scent, it assaults my senses. Also this is called Lys, and I don’t smell any Lys at all. Smells divine on clothes however.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1876285"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1876285#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1866848" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1866848" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hirotino"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1780277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1780277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hirotino" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1866848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1866848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); White floral frags are very popular here but this is top notch among them. I just love it so much. I’m a guy but I enjoy wearing it a lot. Of course it is white floral, but on my skin it’s just this super clean scent. Who cares if it’s considered “feminine”. Flowers are for everybody✌︎</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1866848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1866848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1858836" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Tuberose heavy and a bit too sweet for my taste now.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1845057"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1845057#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1841639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; So creamy and clean and comforting. I love this best out of the Le Labo line!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1841639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1841639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1834714" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1834714" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="churinl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/731667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.731667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="churinl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-Dusita/Rosarine-80375.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80375.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosarine"title="Rosarine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1834714ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1834714" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/731667">churinl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-05-16">05/16/23 15:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is no doubt in my mind that this is a beautiful white floral, at least on my skin. Unfortunately, my skin amps the tuberose to a point where it almost obliterates most other notes, and I was hoping that the lily would be more pronounced. It is detectable, but as it develops, it becomes more beachy and reminds me quite a bit of Guerlain's Lys Soleia, which I already own.<br />
The lily does a wonderful job augmenting the tuberose, but I already own many wonderful tuberoses and don't really need another in my collection, especially considering the price of a full bottle.<br />
I have a 15 ml bottle, and given the strength and tenacity of the juice, that will be more than enough to last me a long time provided I keep it refrigerated. If you are seeking a vibrant, sweet tuberose fragrance, this would do quite nicely, but if it's lily you seek, I'd look elsewhere.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1834714"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1834714#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1816007" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1816007" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scentsbycobb"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487329"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1487329.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scentsbycobb" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/De-Los-Santos-72693.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72693.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="De Los Santos"title="De Los Santos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1816007ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1816007" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1487329">scentsbycobb</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-23">04/23/23 20:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Creamy floral heaven. This is definitely unisex (what is gender in fragrance anymore, anyways?). Perfect for spring and summer. Love love love!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1816007"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1816007#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1814452" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1814452" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ilikewhatilike"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516720"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1516720.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ilikewhatilike" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1814452ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1814452" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1516720">Ilikewhatilike</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-21">04/21/23 16:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best white florals I’ve tried. <br />
<br />
Creamy lily and tuberose that transports you into plush holidays. It dries down to an intoxicating vanilla and sandalwood, but maintains its classy vibe. <br />
<br />
The vanilla-tuberose avoids the crass concoctions that designers belt out. This remains delicious and highly wearable and sunny at all times. <br />
<br />
Performance is great for such a natural smelling composition. <br />
<br />
I slept on this for a long time, but now I want to sleep with it, and do everything else with it as well. It can accentuate femininity for the ladies, but I’m a lad and don’t think it’s too wild to stop me wearing it.<br />
<br />
Edit: I showered myself all over with sprays at a boutique (with a little bit of ylang on one arm) and as I walked down the street I was stopped by a couple that picked up my cloud. They said they were stopped in their tracks and thought it was the store across the road. As I walked past them the second time they realised it was me and asked what I was wearing. I shared and pointed out the le labo store. (It’s a small street) but minutes later we crossed paths again and they said they were on their way to make a purchase as it was the best scent they had ever smelt. That hasn’t happened to me before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1814452"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1814452#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1812826" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1812826" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jordan 99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647482"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1647482.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jordan 99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1812826ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1812826" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647482">Jordan 99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-19">04/19/23 14:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful, classy, elegant, light white florals. Tuberose is so ethereal in here, vanilla just gently sweetens it up without being too obvious. Very sophisticated mature perfume, without being heavy, actually feels young but mature.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1812826"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1812826#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1800391" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1800391" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragspice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1524163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1524163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragspice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/La-Perla/Once-Upon-A-Garden-67572.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.67572.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Once Upon A Garden"title="Once Upon A Garden"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1800391ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1800391" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1524163">fragspice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-04">04/04/23 11:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First thoughts in spraying this were hella beachy......white florals.....tuberose to be more specific.  I also get sort of a banana note but white florals can often do that for me. Many have compared this to Carnal Flower which I also get. I really like this for a summer scent but it's not anything that I haven't smelled before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1800391"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1800391#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1799218" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1799218" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fwuity"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557016"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1557016.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fwuity" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1799218ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1799218" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1557016">fwuity</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-04-03">04/03/23 04:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>it smells of walking sundazed under a bright, dazzling sun, bearing an armful of big white flowers that fill the air with their heady and intoxicating perfume. the lily is freshly plucked from its bed so that the leaves are lush green against springy stems. this is a flower for Anne of Green Gables, lover of beautiful things; something one sniffs with abandon to fall into ecstasies, to fling oneself on a bed of long grasses, to pick a bouquet with greedy hands, to listen to a chorus of jasmine with cupped ear like the petal of a calla lily.<br />
<br />
green and piercing, in the same genre as carnal flower. unripe buds that bloom with vanillic sweetness in the drydown. a bit sunscreeny for me, and the constant headiness can overwhelm (especially with the greedy sniffing it inspires) — but with it comes an illusion of sunshine.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1799218"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1799218#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1792813" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1792813" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lessthanzero"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512520"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1512520.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lessthanzero" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/James-Heeley/Hippie-Rose-12956.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12956.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hippie Rose"title="Hippie Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1792813ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1792813" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512520">lessthanzero</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-25">03/25/23 23:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 is a bright white, solar, floral composition but constructed so architecturally, so precisely, that it seems almost austere... even severe. <br />
<br />
The opening blast of florals is piercingly bright and sharp, like the sunspots and halos you get in your eyes when you stare directly into the sun. <br />
<br />
In the heart, Lys 41 becomes a slightly beachy floral, with a nectar-y sweet bouquet of ylang and tuberose. Somehow though, despite the tropical touches, it remains a little aloof. "Look but don't touch."<br />
<br />
The base is a tasteful combination of blonde woods and a *perfect* airy, translucent vanilla. Lys 41 lasts almost a full 24 hours on my skin. <br />
<br />
Sophisticated, pretty, and interesting. I may consider upgrading to a 50ML when my 15ML is exhausted. <br />
<br />
4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1792813"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1792813#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1782659" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1782659" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sandra_101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674985"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1674985.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sandra_101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Carnal-Flower-1024.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1024.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carnal Flower"title="Carnal Flower"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1782659ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1782659" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1674985">sandra_101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-03-13">03/13/23 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 is a high-quality white floral, start to finish. It opens with a joyfully clean, airy, light-filled bouquet of white flowers. I got a bit bored with the drydown though, to be honest. The heart of this scent is a bright, clean-musky jasmine/lily that falls somewhere between 'classic' and 'dated'. <br />
<br />
I think there's definitely a place for fragrances like this, that don't wear you out with their complexity and big personality. It's well-constructed, doesn't fall apart at drydown, and has a surprising longevity. <br />
<br />
In short: It's a consistently lovely white floral fragrance that just doesn't capture my imagination.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1782659"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1782659#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1769074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1769074" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="kinanaldhia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1682959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1682959.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="kinanaldhia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1769074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1769074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1682959">kinanaldhia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-25">02/25/23 10:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh WOW. I didn't expect to like this at all but I LOVE IT. Definitely one of my favourite scents of all time. I sprayed it on my skin earlier this morning and on me, it still smells so so so good. It has a slight sweetness and woodiness, which I really like. The price points hurts me sooo much but of how much I like this perfume I might loosen up my wallet a bit. Also, the scent bubble stays close, but it lasts all day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1769074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1769074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1767920" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1767920" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stephanienwc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/739155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.739155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stephanienwc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1767920ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1767920" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/739155">stephanienwc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-23">02/23/23 22:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favourites out of the Le Labo classic line. However, Prada Candy Kiss has a similar effect and is more wearable (more musky) and much easier on the wallet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1767920"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1767920#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1755778" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1755778" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MatchaCat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669531"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1669531.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MatchaCat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1755778ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1755778" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1669531">MatchaCat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-09">02/09/23 08:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I ordered samples directly from Le Labo's website. Le Labo mixes their perfumes on the spot and they recommend you keep them in the refrigerator because they don't have preservatives so they spoil quicker. Initially, all my samples smelled out of this world. However, after a week or two, they lost their "magic" and settled into their actual smells. My reviews are based on what they will eventually smell like. <br />
<br />
Lys is basically pungent, cloying white and yellow florals. There are no other non-floral notes for balance. While I do enjoy floral perfumes like Byredo's Casablanca Lily and Kilian's Good Girl Gone Bad, I'm not a fan of pungent florals. There needs to be a balance. Also, this smells dated.<br />
<br />
Smell: 4 out of 10<br />
Longevity: 8 out of 10<br />
Feminine<br />
<br />
For reference, I'm female.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1755778"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1755778#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1752764" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1752764" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="atv315"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33264"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.33264.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="atv315" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Burberry-Women-818.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.818.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Burberry Women"title="Burberry Women"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1752764ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1752764" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/33264">atv315</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-05">02/05/23 14:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>While I love the smell of white flowers out in the world, I don’t like to wear scents where they are this dominant. That said, even if I wouldn’t buy or wear this for myself, this is absolutely beautiful. Imho this is definitely a safe  blind buy for anyone who enjoys these notes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1752764"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1752764#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1750921" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1750921" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emilyclobianco"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1264482"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1264482.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="emilyclobianco" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1750921ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1750921" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1264482">emilyclobianco</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-02-03">02/03/23 12:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Don't normally wear florals but this is just so gorgeous, like a walk through a summer garden with flowers in full bloom. Get a hint of sunscreen in there but its intoxicating. Super feminine fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1750921"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1750921#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1741891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1741891" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sniffathon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1357164.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sniffathon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1741891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1741891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1357164">Sniffathon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-24">01/24/23 00:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Although not the kind of fragrance I would actually wear, I’m testing this out of interest and WOW what a beauty! Heady Lily and tuberose combo with the subtlest of woodiness. It is strong but has a breezy salty quality at the same time (reminds me ever so slightly of JHAG Vanilla Vibes). I was worried about the animalic classification but am relieved it is more of a savoury musk than straight skankiness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1741891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1741891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1740504" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1740504" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="soso.sofia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575778"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1575778.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="soso.sofia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Martin-Margiela/By-the-Fireplace-31623.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31623.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="By the Fireplace"title="By the Fireplace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1740504ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1740504" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1575778">soso.sofia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-22">01/22/23 07:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was lucky to receive a vial of Lys 41 for intense testing. On myself Lys 41 gets off to a good start, smelling of beautiful white florals. During its wear it morphs in and out of being some kind of very expensive sun lotion kind of smell. I don't see the point of paying a Le Labo price tag to feel like I put on sunscreen.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1740504"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1740504#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1736913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1736913" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jassca99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/614231"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.614231.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jassca99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1736913ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1736913" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/614231">jassca99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-18">01/18/23 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Technically a blind-buy earlier this month because I purchased a sample somewhere else but then purchased a personalized bottle I can’t return before receiving the sample. This is Amouage Love Tuberose, white floral vanilla bomb, with less sweetness but sweetness present nonetheless. If there was ever a suspicion that Love Tuberose was slightly too dense for summer, this would be the perfect option for warm weather. Very floral and beachy. The lily is more present when the juice is freshest and funny enough adds a floral freshness. However the tuberose still is the dominant player and thankfully I don’t get jasmine. This smells like refined coconut sunscreen. Although it’s not ground-breaking, I don’t mind as long as it’s not a salted sunscreen scent. It’s also a classic mature white floral. Duality of both.<br />
<br />
You can definitely find and should find less expensive options for this if you have a long wishlist or a vast collection and do not intend on refilling frequently, but I personally want a minimal collection so this works better for me in the long-run. I know Le Labo advices on refilling yearly due to the juice being vegan and lacking preservatives. So keep that in mind, the juice isn’t meant to stretch because it will degrade. Also, I just noticed my birthday is on the label in the Lys image on here. That helps lol</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1736913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1736913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1736367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1736367" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hollandbri"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001169"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1001169.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hollandbri" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/J-adore-L-Or-2023-84202.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84202.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="J'adore L'Or (2023)"title="J'adore L'Or (2023)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1736367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1736367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1001169">hollandbri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-01-17">01/17/23 11:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Truly a stunner, if you have passed on Le Labo because of the laboratory/vintage pharmacy type vibe, check this beauty out. I feel like my on going hunt for the perfect white floral is satisfied (for now ;) ). This is the only perfume that checks off all boxes for me. Fatty, blooming flowers, cloud like sillage, long lasting, feminine, tropical and luxurious smelling. Has the same vibe as EL Bronze Goddess and the ever famous Guerlain Terracotta but this one wears oh so much longer!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1736367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1736367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1719811" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1719811" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lmnsvgz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259533.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lmnsvgz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Armani-Prive-Vert-Malachite-34588.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.34588.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"title="Armani Prive Vert Malachite"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1719811ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1719811" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259533">lmnsvgz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-29">12/29/22 02:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A strong white floral, prominent tuberose. It is very feminine but it smells a bit dated.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1719811"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1719811#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1713902" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1713902" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="montgomery99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509339"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1509339.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="montgomery99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Sycomore-Eau-de-Parfum-41780.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41780.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"title="Sycomore Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1713902ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1713902" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1509339">montgomery99</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-20">12/20/22 22:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells like deplaning in Hawaii at night. Beautiful, tropical, heady white florals--and just the hint of something gasoline like and animalic in the distance. This doesn't smell like a white floral soliflore, however, I am almost certain ylang ylang is somewhere in the mix, adding a lush ripeness to it that elevates its realism (after all, where in nature would you smell purely white florals?) The dry down features a bit of the famous Le Labo (laundry) musk, which I admit I am not a fan of, but it isn't as biting or strong as it is in Santal 33 or Tonka 25. <br />
<br />
Wear this for when you want to feel like a Greek God. One of the most natural smelling floral fragrances on the market, far surpassing TF's Jasmine Rouge (and Fleur de Portofino, for that matter). The only thing stopping me from buying this is that it doesn't smell like "me", but if I had unlimited funds, this would certainly have a welcome spot on the dresser--and I would reach for it when I really want to draw someone in.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1713902"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1713902#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1704655" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1704655" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jeff Shin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1336585"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1336585.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jeff Shin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Houbigant/Iris-des-Champs-28138.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28138.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris des Champs"title="Iris des Champs"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1704655ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1704655" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1336585">Jeff Shin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-12-08">12/08/22 04:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An ultra-creamy and dense lily + tuberose fantasy. For the first few minutes after the initial spray, I got a rather green and fresh lily scent that was glorious. Moist and slightly spicy, and full of freshness. This green white floral heaven is quickly gone though on my skin, turning very dense and creamy and more tuberose forward. The dry down reveals a very vanillic opulent tuberose scent that is very much on the body butter type of thickness of textures. I still love this vanillic tuberose but I had really hoped for the lily-dominant opening to last.<br />
<br />
Lasts all day on the skin and on clothes and projects insanely. I received a ton of compliments whilst wearing this on a cold and crisp winter day. Personally, because of the thick vanillic dry down, I prefer to wear this in the colder months but I do think people can pull this off in the warmer seasons like late spring, or even cooler summer nights.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1704655"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1704655#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1691939" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1691939" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeChxslxy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1602837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1602837.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeChxslxy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1691939ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1691939" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1602837">LeChxslxy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-19">11/19/22 13:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it! Very opulent fragrance. Simple yet sophisticated.<br />
Might as well get some small samples as wedding giveaways for the guest.<br />
If you want a dupe, get a Madonna’s Truth or Dare</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1691939"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1691939#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1684841" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1684841" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="airsigns"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1605735"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1605735.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="airsigns" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1684841ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1684841" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1605735">airsigns</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-11-09">11/09/22 15:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 is an elegant mix of tuberose, jasmine, lily, vanilla, and sandalwood. Truly one of the most beautiful, intoxicating white florals I've ever tried. Tuberose and jasmine are the most prominent in the mix. The familiar waxy, spicy scent of lily makes an appearance after the first hour, though its a bit muted. The base notes are a pleasant mix of what's left of the white flowers plus vanilla and sandalwood, giving it a slight sultriness. Lys 41 might be a liiiiiittle cloying at first, but she softens up within the first 20 minutes into something sophisticated and warm. There is nothing cool or aquatic about this fragrance. Lys 41 does her best during the spring, summer, and on warm nights (especially when getting cozy with a lover). Everything about this fragrance is classically feminine, but it works well for any man brave enough to sport a bouquet of white florals on his pulse points. This was my signature a few years back and I constantly return to it for special occasions and date nights. Out of all the perfumes in my collection, this one has gotten me the most compliments from men and women alike.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1684841"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1684841#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1672380" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1672380" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sianfield"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560762"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1560762.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sianfield" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1672380ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1672380" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1560762">Sianfield</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-23">10/23/22 09:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Went to Le Labo looking to buy Santal 33 and came out with Lys. Classic perfume but with a little modern twist.  I find longevity decent (5-6 hrs but longer on clothes) and sillage starts off very good but does fade off after about 3-4 hrs. It is always a bottle I keep on my shelf and definitely a fragrance I wear to more sophisticated events vs a wild night out with the girls.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1672380"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1672380#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1663906" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1663906" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Air of Grace"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1385605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Air of Grace" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/A-La-Nuit-513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A La Nuit"title="A La Nuit"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1663906ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1663906" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1385605">Air of Grace</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-10-11">10/11/22 14:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got 5 floral samples from Le Labo to see what the hype was about and I was so disappointed !<br />
<br />
For the high end price tag , I would of thought the scents would project well but all stay close to the skin and disappear within an hour . <br />
<br />
Lys 41 was my favourite to try but on my skin it starts out very sharp - indolic/ animalic and stays that way for over thirty minutes .<br />
<br />
I can’t smell any notes cause the sharp , peppery smell takes over the entire scent . <br />
<br />
Definite no for me and like the perfume house , Creed which I find have similar composition perfumes - light and synthetic , none appeal to my nose .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; When carnal flower is tuberose in the jungle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1649876"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1649876#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1643534" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
