This is a classic perfume through and through. Love at first sniff for me. This is such an elegant, creamy white floral. Perfectly blended.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1631666"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1631666#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1624570" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1624570" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="raidiological"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242256"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1242256.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="raidiological" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1624570ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1624570" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242256">raidiological</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-16">08/16/22 00:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really adore Le Labo florals, especially this beauty. Depsite the “Lys” name, I sense tuberose and jasmine more than the lily itself. Lys 41 has the vanillic-summery feeling that reminds me of Neroli 36, but I prefer the vanilla notes from Lys more since it blends very beautifully with the florals here. Truly gorgeous.<br />
<br />
Projects moderately &amp; the longevity is a beast. I have a 10mL decant with me &amp; i’m pretty sure it will last for ages since I only need 2-3 sprays for a full wear.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1624570"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1624570#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1622077" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1622077" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sunshine0101"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/41344"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.41344.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sunshine0101" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Washington-Square-9650.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9650.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Washington Square"title="Washington Square"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1622077ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1622077" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/41344">sunshine0101</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-12">08/12/22 05:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great scent but overpowered by Tuberose and Jasmine. I couldn’t smell anything else. That’s it. Those 2 notes hide everything behind them. Don’t get me wrong, I love those notes, absolutely. But I wouldn’t pay top dollar to get them. I can easily buy pure essential oils and apply that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1622077"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1622077#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1618074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1618074" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sjefke"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543916"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sjefke" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Noir-Extreme-29675.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29675.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Noir Extreme"title="Noir Extreme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1618074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1618074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1543916">Sjefke</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-06">08/06/22 07:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love at first sight. I smelled this fragrance for the first time years ago. Instantly fell in love with it. It reminds me of something from the past. But can't recall what.<br />
White flowers, especially lily and tuberose, are my favorite notes.<br />
Due to the high price, I did not buy the fragrance. But I kept thinking about the smell. But no matter what fragrance I bought, none of them match Lys 41.<br />
But luckily I bought this fragrance a few weeks ago.<br />
<br />
It smells like a vase full of white flowers. Not only a lily, but also a tuberose and gardenia are in the vase. You can also smell the green fresh stems of the flowers. It is a full fresh bouquet. Nothing more or less.<br />
On my skin, the scent changes after a fresh start to a slightly more creamy variant.<br />
It's a subtle scent. No screamy and oldish smell. In my opinion for every age and wearable in every season.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1618074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1618074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1616266" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1248051">cherubi rubi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-03">08/03/22 12:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>265<br />
I don't get lily from this.<br />
This is a tuberose along the lines of Beyond Love, but a much gentler, weaker, non-tropical version-like a skeleton of BL without the punch. <br />
It has just a little bit of everything, this tuberose...<br />
I like it though and got a decant to see if it's more than a like. Cause I love BY, but can't get any...<br />
8/10-gentle, balanced tuberose, but no lilies.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1616266"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1616266#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1606537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1603146" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AlecGutteridge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1454977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AlecGutteridge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Histoires-de-Parfums/1740-Marquis-de-Sade-8590.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8590.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1740 Marquis de Sade"title="1740 Marquis de Sade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1603146ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1603146" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454977">AlecGutteridge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-14">07/14/22 15:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The only Le Labo scent I've tried so far that I can say is actually good. I would say its an exclusively feminine scent though, so not something that I will be wearing. A dry, woody, vanillic, white floral. Classically simple - won't knock your socks off. 7/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1603146"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1603146#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1598471" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1598471" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LSAUG"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324444"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="LSAUG" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Avon/Rare-Emeralds-15690.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15690.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rare Emeralds"title="Rare Emeralds"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1598471ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1598471" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1324444">LSAUG</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-07">07/07/22 10:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Honeysuckle and tuberose.  It is also giving me Gucci Bloom vibes.  Smells almost identical.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1598471"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1598471#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1595043" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1595043" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="zcbensel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508856"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="zcbensel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1595043ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1595043" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1508856">zcbensel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-01">07/01/22 17:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Recently snagged this guy from the Le Labo store in SOHO. This, Santal 33 and Noir 29 are my favorites from this house, but I could only afford to go home with one so Lys 41 was my choice. I don't know if its fair to call this a women's fragrance outright. I'm a fairly hetero cis-male and this fragrance still feels comfortable on me. Granted, I like to get adventurous with my scents but I would categorize this as purely unisex.<br />
<br />
The fragrance itself is very pleasant. Nice dry floral with hints of vanilla and dry woods that help round out the fragrance. The musk is present, but as more of a supplement that gives the fragrance a slight "vibration".<br />
<br />
The projection is decent, but not immense. About 2ft for the first 2 hours, 1ft after the next 2 hours, then close to the skin for the next 4 hours.<br />
<br />
The drydown is also pleasant, coming down to clean-earthy wood musk by hour 8. <br />
<br />
Overall, worth the Le Labo tag. Clean and pleasant, but not boring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1595043"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1595043#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1594291" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1594291" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Enrium"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.36833.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Enrium" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Glossier/You-46885.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46885.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="You"title="You"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1594291ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1594291" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/36833">Enrium</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-30">06/30/22 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lys 41 is a simple, sweet white floral scent. It prominently features lily and tuberose with a nice musky vanilla drydown. While it is not groundbreaking, it is beautiful and has excellent performance. I enjoy a well-put-together white floral, and L41 is just that. Too pared-back to be mistaken for a 80s powerhouse, yet with enough sweetness to be youthful, L41 is quite timeless to me.<br />
<br />
Tuberose rears its head from the initial spray. Creamy, sweet and lush, it is very pleasant but quite intense. Waxy, slightly funereal lily joins it, alongside sweet jasmine, making for a white floral accord that reminds me of Frédéric Malle Carnal Flower. I get some tropical ylang ylang in there too, which, along with the jasmine note, makes me think of Annick Goutal Songes. It is a big, heady, sweet bouquet, lasting for hours and becoming powdery as time passes.<br />
<br />
Some woody notes emerge as it dries down, but vanilla is more prominent - soft and powdery, it adds smooth sweetness that compliments the florals nicely. Clean, white musk joins in as it fades, blurring the edges and tying everything together beautifully. Sillage is quite strong and longevity is long-lasting - apply sparingly.<br />
<br />
Sweetly feminine yet simple and classy, this is a lovely spring/summer floral scent with beachy nuances. Easy elegance, with just the right amount of opulence, L41 is classic yet modern. 4/5.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1594291"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1594291#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1590374" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1590374" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RisingChaos"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1352837"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1352837.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RisingChaos" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1590374ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1590374" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1352837">RisingChaos</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-23">06/23/22 22:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Creamy white and yellow floral bomb. Smells like a truckload of tuberose with a healthy dose of ylang-ylang, plus a light touch of jasmine all atop a soft-serve French vanilla base. Sunscreenish, as many say. Moderate projection fades through 3-4hr, catching faint whiffs for many hours to follow, longevity 12hr+.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1590374"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1590374#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1589383" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1589383" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Golfgal426"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/80809"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.80809.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Golfgal426" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Fragrance-Du-Bois/Oud-Orange-Intense-24482.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24482.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Orange Intense"title="Oud Orange Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1589383ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1589383" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/80809">Golfgal426</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-22">06/22/22 11:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just bought this, and it's the kind of fragrance I would sell my entire collection for. It's beautiful, creamy floral that inspires confidence and beauty. My mom, who hates most of my fragrances, smelled it and said, "what is that? It smells so pretty!" I am noticing that it's pretty strong, so you don't need much!<br />
<br />
Just really pretty. A signature, for sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1589383"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1589383#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1584062" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1584062" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="helenearne"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458178"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1458178.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="helenearne" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1584062ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1584062" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1458178">helenearne</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-14">06/14/22 03:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is beautiful. So smooth and creamy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1584062"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1584062#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1565401" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1565401" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ephemeral"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/54335"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ephemeral" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1565401ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1565401" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/54335">ephemeral</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-16">05/16/22 22:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As others have said, a sillage beast in the beginning, and potent for a solid 3 hours.  When it's cooler out (below 19° Celsius) it's screechy, sugary, headachy.  When it's warmer out (25° Celsius and up), it's sun-drenched, narcotic, slightly sunscreen-y/sorta like expensive Monoi.  But for me it's in the dry down that it really draws you in - after 5 hours, it's pure musk, more than a little skanky, but only for the nose that gets to come right up to your skin.  <br />
<br />
In general; yes, Le Labo fragrances are expensive - but I've found (after wearing them for 13 years, i.e. pre-Estéban Lauder) that they both mature very well, and also last incredibly long as they're so potent that two sprays are almost always enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1565401"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1565401#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1563496" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1563496" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="smmegst"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503351"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="smmegst" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1563496ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1563496" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1503351">smmegst</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-13">05/13/22 23:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my signature scent and the only le labo scent that is worth the money to me. I have it in both the oil and spray form. The spray leans more floral while the oil leans more vanilla. I love white florals, but usually don't gravitate towards vanilla scents (usually sweet scents smell sour at the end to me) but this vanilla just works. I wouldn't say this is a gourmand fragrance, but it is romantic, ethereal and sweet. While I don't have a partner but I know I will wear this on my wedding day! That's just the energy and vibe I get from this.<br />
I love the contrast of the florals' projection with the skin hugging intimacy of the vanilla. If you are iffy on white florals like tuberose then this is probably not the scent for you, but if you are not normally a vanilla/sweet perfume person this could be the perfect middle ground for you (like it was for me!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1563496"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1563496#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1555814" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1555814" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="silthrill"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449134"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1449134.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="silthrill" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1555814ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1555814" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1449134">silthrill</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-02">05/02/22 21:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>the holy trinity of the white florals - tuberose, jasmine, lily. None of the three are introverts. I am still trying to warm up to this trifecta, but I can certainly appreciate the quality of this fragrance. For someone who is into smelling like straight up flowers, this is a beautiful transportive fragrance. Actually it reminds me of a much more refined version of Aerin's Hibiscus Palm - Lys 41 is not a beachy /sunscreen scent but it can definitely be a token summer floral fragrance. It smells like the flowers on a tropical vacation</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1555814"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1555814#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1547865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1547865" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ponderbread"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141339"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141339.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ponderbread" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1547865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1547865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141339">ponderbread</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-21">04/21/22 08:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I went through a tuberose phase a couple of years ago and have rediscovered some samples from that time. For the most part, I've been finding them okay, but not enough to reignite my tuberose passion (I'm just, like, really into patchouli right now). Lys 41 is the first that has made me stop and say wow. It's just the right balance of white florals and sweetness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1547865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1547865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1544731" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1544731" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wondervalley666"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wondervalley666" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Salum-Parfums/Cocoyster-90755.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90755.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cocoyster"title="Cocoyster"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1544731ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1544731" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1461605">wondervalley666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-04-16">04/16/22 11:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite scent from Le Labo! Unsure as to why this was named Lys, as it’s a tuberose scent. Tuberose is at least 85% - 90% of what I smell from this fragrance. Other notes are softly well blended to enhance the tuberose. It does have a warm, summery tuberose monoi feel. Smells like clean young sunkissed skin. It doesn’t have the green sharp eucalyptus vibe of Carnal Flower or Moon Bloom, and it lacks the sugary bubble gum gourmand sweetness of Love Tuberose. It's stronger, better performing, and slightly more musky/less soapy than Gucci Bloom. I can pick up some green notes in the first 15 minutes and then they fade into the warm summery tropical smelling tuberose. My only issue is that I seem to go anosmic to this scent after an hour or so. It isn’t a beast-mode fragrance, no matter how much you overspray, but it is much stronger and longer lasting than any other tuberose scent I've tried. After an hour I mostly get gentle bursts of this when I smell myself directly. Though if I spray before bed, I can still subtly smell this when I wake up. I don’t think this smells mature at all, to me it does remind me of some sunscreen I used as a kid 20+ yrs ago back when sunscreens smelled amazing, so it reminds me of the way I used to smell when I was under the age of 10. It doesn’t have coconut or other sunscreen notes so it’s close, but doesn’t quite enter the sunscreen genre. I really don’t get any lily or jasmine at all, and I own/wear Alien and Jasmine Sambac body oil regularly and I have a garden full of jasmine. Gucci Bloom has more of lily dominance than Lys 41. I do not know what Santal 33/sandalwood notes others refer to here. I’m a Santal/sandalwood lover and would say this is a tropical floral scent with no obvious woody notes, it certainly doesn't have any sort of sharp green sandlewood/pickle accord (I don't read Santal 33 as pickles but I know what note others refer to as pickles - to me it smells more green fresh crisp almost like cucumber). I know a lot of people refer to tuberose scents like this and Carnal Flower as elegant lady scents, however they work very well on more casual, earthy types of women as well. I don’t feel like putting on a fancy dress and heels when I wear this, I feel like wearing a sexy bikini or a white crop top with cut off jean shorts. Maybe a flowy beachy vacation dress. Love it, I’m still looking for something similar with a bit more strength, but this is the best one I've found so far.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1544731"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1544731#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1528949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1528949" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sbosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1448270"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sbosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Eau-Duelle-Eau-de-Toilette-9241.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9241.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"title="Eau Duelle Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1528949ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1528949" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1448270">sbosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-23">03/23/22 11:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Putting this on I aged 30 years</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1528949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1528949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1525942" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1525942" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sewist"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1444183"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sewist" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Portrait-of-a-Lady-10464.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10464.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Portrait of a Lady"title="Portrait of a Lady"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1525942ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1525942" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1444183">Sewist</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-18">03/18/22 15:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been searching for a very long lasting white floral that's not too soft and girlish and I think this is it. Tried one spray on my arm at the counter yesterday afternoon and could still smell it very clearly this morning. Fairly linear after the drydown, but that's ok since I'm actually looking for a straightforward combination of these florals. It is pricey, but it smelled deep, rich and pure to me. I'm wearing Malle's Carnel Flower today (tuberose) and have Aerin's Ikat Jasmine, so any other FB buy will have to be distinct enough to fill a gap. This might be it. Now, let's see if I can be patient and wait for a good offer (store bonus points or product bonus with purchase).</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1525942"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1525942#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1518690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1518690" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lingdeer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1463277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lingdeer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Orpheon-Eau-de-Parfum-65738.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65738.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"title="Orphéon Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1518690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1518690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1463277">lingdeer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-07">03/07/22 22:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a strong heady white floral and definitely overwhelming for some. If you don't like white floral, run ;) But if you are on the opposite end, you have to try this.<br />
I love this way more than le labo tuberose perfume. To me this is tuberose perfume that is milky, soft and even a bit sexy, and not as gourmand I found in Amouage LoveTuberose. This just feel like the flower is creamy itself. I feel very feminine when I wear this. Not bubble gummy, but also definitely not something I would wear to the office.<br />
Longevity of this is awesome. One of the best of from the floral perfume I own. Love that I could still smell the floral note many hours after, which is rare for me. <br />
This is a strong perfume, so a few spritz is more than enough, and I love to layer it with gucci bloom profumo di fiori to give it some brightness. <br />
Also by the way I actually don't own a full bottle. I might get one eventually depending on how I feel about it in the summer. I bought a small vial of sample from le labo website and a little goes a long way (I usually only use 2 spritz at once, 4 max). Samples from le labo are priced similar to a bottle if you consider cost/ml. I would definitely encourage to sample first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1518690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1518690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1512019" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1512019" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mhobol"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293338"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1293338.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mhobol" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Ganymede-54720.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54720.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ganymede"title="Ganymede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1512019ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1512019" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1293338">mhobol</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-25">02/25/22 15:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like my flowers creamy and sweet, but on me this is a dry tuberose cloud. Projection is good, but it's not enough juice. :(</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1512019"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1512019#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1509468" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1509468" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aliebling"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1457163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aliebling" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1509468ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1509468" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1457163">Aliebling</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-22">02/22/22 00:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me this is deep creamy sexy white flowers blooming at night. The florals are very realistic - smells like burying your nose in a white bouquet. I'm new to identifying notes so I'm not sure if it's the tuberose or lily, but from the start this feels very sultry and intimate, with traces of salt and sweet vanilla. <br />
<br />
This was one of the very first samples I tried when discovering perfume and I hated it for some reason, but I tried again on a whim and now I'm obsessed; it might be my favorite so far. Sexy but adult, and subtle enough to be wearable during the day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1509468"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1509468#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1508475" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1508475" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sandradiana"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321240"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1321240.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sandradiana" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Teriaq-89850.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89850.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Teriaq"title="Teriaq"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1508475ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1508475" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1321240">sandradiana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-20">02/20/22 12:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I keep coming back to this, I'm in love, so creamy and soft and feminine, powerful too<br />
Underrated, signature worthy</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1508475"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1508475#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1506599" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1506599" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mayasuren"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1389303"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1389303.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mayasuren" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1506599ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1506599" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1389303">Mayasuren</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-17">02/17/22 20:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Criminally underrated le labo perfume. Stunning white florals, it has this creaminess to it that adds elegance and class wherever you go. Signature scent worthy and you can wear it daytime or night time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1506599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1506599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1497620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1497620" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NaaatNaaat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="NaaatNaaat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Ariana-Grande/Sweet-Like-Candy-39970.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39970.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Like Candy"title="Sweet Like Candy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1497620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1497620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1368487">NaaatNaaat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-04">02/04/22 10:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I only have a sample of this but I am seriously considering getting the whole bottle. This is such a beautiful white floral and on me, it has a very skin like feel it it. It is slightly sweet and a little musky, very feminine. The drydown is nice on me, none of the notes get really lost during the wear. I do think it is VERY expensive for what it is though, I heard the liquid balms are better value than the perfume so I might have to look into that. <br />
If you do like white, bright florals and spring scents, I think you'd like this one!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1497620"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1497620#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1496380" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1496380" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pineneedle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1413838"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1413838.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pineneedle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1496380ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1496380" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1413838">pineneedle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-02-02">02/02/22 13:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nuclear white floral that knows precisely what it is. Lys 41 hits you straight out of the bottle like a bouquet to the head, replete with a fresh greenness. After a few minutes a bubblegum-like tuberose makes its presence known with a bullhorn before transitioning to a more powdery white floral. I love it, but I don't know if I have the emotional strength to live with it every day. <br />
<br />
This perfume subscribes to Southern Living and condescendingly pats your cheek while saying something like "Bless your heart." I've been told it smells just like the streets of New Orleans at night, when the jasmine and gardenias are in full bloom.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1496380"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1496380#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1488149" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1488149" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="danny777"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1448662"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="danny777" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Philosophy/Pure-Grace-4854.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4854.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Grace"title="Pure Grace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1488149ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1488149" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); What an amazing perfume. This is my first blind buy and I am so pleasantly surprised. While the smell is very feminine and floral, it is also quite sophisticated and elegant. It's very powdery on me which I love, but without feeling old-fashioned. The scent is perfectly balanced from start to finish and quite long-lasting. I am truly obsessed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1488149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1488149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1487245" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; <br />
Very lovely, simple, linear, long lasting. I wish it had a bright/juicy element to round it out and make it more nuanced. That would knock it out of the park for me. I give it a "like" even tho I usually hhhhhhhhate white florals, powder, and soft scents like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1487245"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1487245#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1483302" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Super strong and super long lasting but used in moderation, it's not overpowering. You do need to let it age a bit as Le Labo blends to order. It mellows with the vanilla base becoming stronger in about 3 months.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1483302"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1483302#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1468838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
