padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1464089" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brietexas"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169055"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1169055.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brietexas" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kayali-Fragrances/Vanilla-Royale-Sugared-Patchouli-64-Eau-De-Parfum-Intense-77430.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.77430.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanilla Royale Sugared Patchouli | 64 Eau De Parfum Intense"title="Vanilla Royale Sugared Patchouli | 64 Eau De Parfum Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1464089ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1464089" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1169055">brietexas</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-15">12/15/21 14:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this a while back and hardly ever reach for it. The white flowers are gorgeous, but I felt like it was missing something. I also love a vanilla and have Kayali Vanilla 28 in my stash. That's another one I love but sometimes feel it's too "on the nose" vanilla...especially at my age. SO, today I layered them and...WOW...this might be what I've been looking for. Heady white flowers floating over a deep vanilla/amber base. I keep smelling my wrist. So good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1464089"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1464089#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1459523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1459523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="luminaries"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1377655.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="luminaries" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-Malle/Portrait-of-a-Lady-10464.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10464.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Portrait of a Lady"title="Portrait of a Lady"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1459523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1459523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1377655">luminaries</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-08">12/08/21 01:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a heady tuberose and jasmine mix. It's really reminiscent of Jo Malone's Jasmine Sambac and Marigold to me, but it's not as bitter and has a beachiness to it. It also has a musky, woody base that is typical to most Le Labo perfumes that I really enjoyed smelling in the dry down. In fact, the dry down was my favorite part when it mixed with the white florals. Is this a lily perfume? As it develops, yes I think so, but the tuberose is the strongest player here. But this is still one of my favorite white floral perfumes and it smells beautiful on a sunny day. The longevity and sillage are both great and I do find this to be a unisex-feminine perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1459523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1459523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1455580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1455580" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lifeisaloha129"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409519"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lifeisaloha129" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1455580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1455580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409519">lifeisaloha129</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-01">12/01/21 10:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a pretty white floral fragrance. At first sniff, I immediatly bought it and I dont regret. Notes are quite simple, the musk grows on skin softly over time mixed with vanille. Kinda too simple notes when you take price into account.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1455580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1455580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1436516" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1436516" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carpe Noctem"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1064111"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1064111.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carpe Noctem" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Pierre-Guillaume-Paris/Myrrhiad-13360.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13360.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Myrrhiad"title="Myrrhiad"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1436516ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1436516" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1064111">Carpe Noctem</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-29">10/29/21 01:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I mostly get tuberose and lily, but after twenty minutes I can smell the vanilla prominently and the musk. It reminds me of sunscreen sometimes. It gives a very happy, carefree vibe and while I think it mostly fit Spring and Summertime, I can see this giving someone with the winter doldrums a huge lift! I don't live in a cold climate anymore, but if I did, I'd spray it all over in the middle of winter when I can't imagine the cold will ever go away or the sun will ever shine again. <br />
<br />
Had to buy an entire bottle of this magic potion!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1436516"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1436516#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1432608" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1419576" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Aprettygarden2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360184"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360184.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Aprettygarden2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1419576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1419576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360184">Aprettygarden2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-30">09/30/21 06:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like a really nice creamy tanning oil without that sharpness. I could see this for spring/summer. The creaminess in the scent really blossoms near the end and it’s not overbearing and cloying. Very pretty. FBW. <br />
Edit: no longer fbw unfortunately. Really causes my asthma to act up. Damn you asthma! Ha!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1419576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1419576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1417293" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1417293" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="debra0503"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1323704"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1323704.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="debra0503" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Amouage/Lilac-Love-35624.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35624.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lilac Love"title="Lilac Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1417293ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1417293" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1323704">debra0503</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-09-26">09/26/21 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m slightly disappointed, all I can pick up is the extremely heady tuberose, my skin tend to really amplify tuberose, one of the most tricky floral notes for me. Give it a little more time it gets better and smoother when the other white flowers start to fight for their presence, but still very tuberose dominant<br />
<br />
Reminds me too much of Gucci bloom but I admit it’s a more refined version</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1417293"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1417293#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402263" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402263" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DarlingNikki"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.6977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DarlingNikki" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402263ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402263" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/6977">DarlingNikki</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 20:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is vintage Sand &amp; Sable The Niche Version and I am here for it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1402263"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1402263#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1402010" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1402010" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eribert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1302689.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eribert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1402010ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1402010" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689">Eribert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 11:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This rather should have been called "Tubéreuse 41" because the tuberose and the vanilla are so overpowering and - and I don't think I have used that term before - cloying, that they destroy any illusion of this being a character study of the essence of a lily. <br />
<br />
Lys 41 is bubblegumy, soft and sweet and even a bit woody but lacks the dark, deep, spicy aspects a lily usually holds. Therefore, being a lily-lover, for me this utterly fails to deliver. <br />
<br />
Projection, quality of ingredients and longevity are not an issue, but the fact that you don't really get what you were promised, is. That is why for me, this is just an "okay" fragrance.<br />
<br />
 I don't recommend this as a lily fragrance. If you are looking for a magnificent cool and spicy lily, Oriza's "Relique d'Amour" is a much better option. In case you are looking for a fluffy yet complex high-quality "white" perfume, you can give Lys 41 a try. It is rather unisex and will be a perfect fit for today's young (30ish), gentle urbanite. However, especially given the price tag, do not blind-buy.<br />
<br />
TL;DR: soft, white, fluffy - more tuberose than lily</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1402010"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1402010#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1401862" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1401862" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="honeyedflora"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1125316"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1125316.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="honeyedflora" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1401862ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1401862" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1125316">honeyedflora</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-31">08/31/21 06:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Musky, soft and sweet vanilla, sandalwood, and the most enchanting full-bodied Lilium Candidum (the Madonna lily that I'm used to). The lily prevails on the tuberose and on the jasmine, nevertheless, this is one of the prettiest white florals around. No scratchy, shrill synthetic white flowers here, just creamy softness and powdery tenderness. I associate it with a ballerina who's wearing a cream-colored tutu twirling around in the garden under the sunshine.<br />
Reminds me a tiny bit of Fleur Nocturne by Isabey and of Gardenia Petale. The muskiness in here reminds me a little bit of the one found in Narciso by Narciso Rodriguez.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1401862"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1401862#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1398624" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1398624" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Annata"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1231464.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Annata" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Tilia-91688.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.91688.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tilia"title="Tilia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1398624ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1398624" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1231464">Annata</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-25">08/25/21 10:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume is 100% Historie d’Orangers but a little bit stronger and it last longer than HdO. Smells like orange, orange blossom and tuberose. I love it</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1398624"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1398624#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1396705" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1396705" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Swedelish"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128461"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1128461.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Swedelish" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chance-Eau-Tendre-8069.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8069.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chance Eau Tendre"title="Chance Eau Tendre"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1396705ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1396705" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128461">Swedelish</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-21">08/21/21 23:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A tropical haven of dreamy, sun-sweetened white flowers and yellow ones, too. Gently soapy lilies, camphorous tuberose, green jasmine, banana-esque ylang ylang and vanilla - all doing their thing at the same time. It doesn't take you on a journey, it ends mostly how it started, and I love it for that. It's optimism and elegance in a bottle.<br />
<br />
Smells expensive, well blended. Smooth. Never loud or obnoxious, as long as it's not extremely over sprayed. In which case it can become a bit heady. It's a bossy white floral, but a perfect floral imo. <br />
<br />
It has airy and light qualities, but it's not fleeting or soft. It has a perfect amount of density and volume and  doesn't go full-fat like some buttery florals do. It moves with me, through space freely and beautifully. It projects tenaciously and lasts all day long, no problem. I can always smell it on myself the next day whenever I wear it to bed, which I've been doing a lot lately. <br />
<br />
Lys 41 is just a stunning, pure tropical floral. One of the best. Lilies aren't too dominant. Florals-wise, it's mostly about the tuberose and ylang ylang. And of course, that delicate Le Labo vanilla that never takes over. <br />
<br />
I adore it. 100% I will be buying a bottle before my samples run out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1396705"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1396705#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1394768" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1394768" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Adiam"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1326147"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1326147.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Adiam" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/M-Micallef/Ylang-in-Gold-14409.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14409.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ylang in Gold"title="Ylang in Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1394768ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1394768" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1326147">Adiam</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-18">08/18/21 19:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Imagine a white floral bouquet being thrown into your face, but you enjoy it so you're not mad. That's what this smells like to me; an in your face, unapologetic white floral fragrance with fantastic projection and longevity. There isn't anything overly dynamic or complex about this one, which is why I think it is so appealing. An easy to wear floral for the spring and summer that will bring you happiness, suitable for daytime occasions. 💮</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1394768"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1394768#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1391891" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1391891" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="The Wolf"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1263755.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="The Wolf" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Bois-D-Argent-48396.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48396.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois D'Argent"title="Bois D'Argent"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1391891ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1391891" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1263755">The Wolf</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-13">08/13/21 18:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like rich, sweet flowers. <br />
Great scent for a woman that loves florals. I normally don't care for overly floral fragrances but this is done to where they somehow smell juicy, like a fruit. <br />
<br />
Admittedly, I'm not experienced with woman's florals and I don't care for men's. But to my nose, this is fine example of niche perfumery, and miles better than anything else from this genre that I have come across.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1391891"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1391891#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1390601" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1390601" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="faithann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222832"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1222832.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="faithann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/English-Pear-Freesia-10314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="English Pear & Freesia"title="English Pear & Freesia"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1390601ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1390601" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1222832">faithann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-11">08/11/21 13:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I loved this scent. It really is a big creamy white floral, to my nose vanilla and jasmine come through the strongest followed by musk and tuberose. Theres almost something salty here and a little bit of cocoa butter. I really mean it in the best way when I say that it reminds me a little of the Victoria's Secret Sun Kissed body lotion. There's a faint suncreen thing going on but the perfume is so fresh and clean, sultry, and sophisticated despite the comparison I just made. An all time summer night scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1390601"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1390601#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1389326" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1389326" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chrisk252"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="chrisk252" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Cerruti/1881-Men-329.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.329.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="1881 Men"title="1881 Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1389326ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1389326" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1185528">chrisk252</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-09">08/09/21 10:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful, soft, ethereal white floral opening with a hint of sweetness. Tuberose and Jasmine. Too feminine for me, but a lovely fragrance. If I had to pick a floral from Le Labo, this might be it tho.<br />
Scent: 8<br />
Sillage: 8<br />
Longevity: 7.5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1389326"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1389326#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1375129" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1375129" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ravenna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1360311.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ravenna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1375129ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1375129" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1360311">ravenna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-07-13">07/13/21 05:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is VERY jasmine to my nose, and then other white florals I cant really identify- the 'others' transform it into a more mature, smoother scent. Sillage for me is truly ginormous. I actually want to escape this scent now but I cant. It's a nice scent, definitely warm so I'm confused by the number of people calling it a summer frag. I live somewhere where its 32 deg c all year round with 80% humidity- this is most suitable for night for me. <br />
<br />
Update- on drying down, the sillage is still enormous but much less jasmine. I can only pick up a common but smooth scent with some character. As the jasmine disappears so do the animalic qualities- now it's all white floral deepened with musk, almost a little powdery. It's sweet but confident, and great for outdoors because of how strong it is. For some reason I see myself wearing this to a rock concert. Crowd-pleasing, but distinct rather than office-friendly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1375129"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1375129#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1367414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1367414" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="butterbean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.365534.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="butterbean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Rose-Centifolia-Extrait-1-87535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"title="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1367414ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1367414" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534">butterbean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-28">06/28/21 14:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is to DIE FOR.   I waited years to sample it, and finally ordered a sample from the company. Upon spraying 1 time.. eyes rolled back heavenly hypnotic beeeeauuutiful, and ordered a full bottle.<br />
<br />
I am soo happy to have this in my collection.  It is a TOP 5 contender for sure!  <br />
<br />
My favorite scents are tuberose, gardenia, lily and the more tropical, sweet kind of fleshy hypnotic heaven -- I am all in. <br />
<br />
<br />
Starts off with sweet lovely tropical tuberose, that becomes more creamy as the lily notes move forward.  <br />
<br />
The lily and tuberose blend soo amazingly well.   As it wears lily is more pronounced, and is super beautiful wafting trumpet/oriental lilies.   <br />
<br />
Nothing is indolic or heady here.  Highly recommend this one!<br />
<br />
<b>Lys 41 is just hands down GORGEOUS<b> 💕</b></b></p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1367414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1367414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1359505" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I’ve never fallen in love as easily and as completely as I have with this. I sprayed it on and immediately knew that this is THE summer floral I need in my wardrobe, and one of only a few perfumes that I love from beginning to end. It’s a fresh, bright, smooth, fleshy white floral on a base of clean musk, and a cool, creamy vanilla that isn’t out of place in this gorgeous tropical composition. Sillage is moderate, longevity is around 5 hours, and then I’m left with the dreamiest YSBB scent. I am thrilled to have this in my wardrobe!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1359505"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1359505#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1355926" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1343366" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="julheart"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1326235"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1326235.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="julheart" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1343366ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1343366" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1326235">julheart</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-14">05/14/21 14:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warm vanilla and flowers. Opens that way... creamy and kinda tropical. Definitely get tuberose and jasmine after a while. Maybe some hints of wood, but just barely. Musky too. I think the jasmine appeals to me... grew up with a lot of it. Love the balance.. As far as florals go I really like it... not screechy or soapy. Soft and easy and a bit sexy - a nice way to feel.<br />
And this stuff really sticks around for a LONG time in a nice way. Jasmine... for hours. I'm into it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1343366"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1343366#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1342890" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1342890" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CaliBlonde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307920"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1307920.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CaliBlonde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/La-Vie-est-Belle-L-Elixir-95856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.95856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"title="La Vie est Belle L'Elixir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1342890ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1342890" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307920">CaliBlonde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-13">05/13/21 17:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Reminds me of Hawaii. Very pretty!<br />
Tropical, floral, beachy.<br />
If you’re looking for a summer scent that doesn’t smell like sunscreen this is perfect. This will transport you to a lush island. <br />
I believe this has tiare flower, which is not noted on here; Nordstrom lists it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1342890"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1342890#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1333487" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1333487" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Carrotlyn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330676"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1330676.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Carrotlyn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Arquiste/Nanban-31896.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31896.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nanban"title="Nanban"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1333487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1333487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330676">Carrotlyn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-27">04/27/21 20:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I will start off my saying that this fragrance is absolutely gorgeous and unlike anything else Le Labo has made. For those unfamiliar with the naming practices from the brand, the number in the title refers to the number of note ingredients in the formulation. So, with Lys, 41 total notes within this floral accord. <br />
<br />
So that out of the way, I don’t register this as a purely white floral scent at all, there are plenty of yellow flowers right at the forefront. Lys 41 is Hawaiian florals in a bottle, with a few other complementary flowers. <br />
Right at the front is Plumeria, followed closely by Heliotrope, Honeysuckle, Ylang Ylang, and then the Lily. Sitting right below the initial floral blast, comfortably in the middle, are solar accords and a very gentle musk. This fragrance is complex, yet straightforward. It’s also one of the more long-lasting fragrances from the house, which is surprising given how florals are typically top notes. <br />
<br />
Spray sparingly, it’s a monster. A gorgeous monster, but a monster nevertheless. <br />
Did I mention that it’s classy as hell? An artfully blended experience to behold. This is something you wear when the sun is out, there’s a nice breeze, and you’ll be enjoying a day out and about.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1333487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1333487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1327215" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1327215" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NDStars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NDStars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1327215ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1327215" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949">NDStars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-17">04/17/21 11:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First blast of powdery sweet vanilla and .. I thought it was soft purple heliotrope but looks like I was fooled by tuberose. Charming and very sweet, I get a fancy baby powder vibe. A tad old-fashioned; I picture high tea in a dainty aunt's dainty parlour with potpourri and sachets of dried flowers hanging everywhere. The sweetness intensifies in the drydown and the projection is rather strong with this one. I wouldn't go heavy on the trigger. After a couple minutes, the scent takes you from the dainty aunt's parlour to the dainty aunt's laundry room. Lily notes usually make me think dryer sheets. Feminine and best for cooler weather. This could easily choke a room in the heat of summer.<br />
<br />
6+ hours later: The stayed surprisingly linear on that sweet tuberose. I expected it to evolve wildly like most Le Labo seems to on my skin. All faded by the 5th hour.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1327215"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1327215#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1324278" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1324278" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Random11233"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317734"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Random11233" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1324278ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1324278" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1317734">Random11233</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-12">04/12/21 14:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells, to me, exactly like sunscreen. I thought I was imagining it, until I came to this site and saw all of the comments that say something similar. It is a pleasant smell. The dry down is a bit of a fuzzy, warm, powdery, floral with a hint of vanilla. It reminds me of fresh beach towels from a ritzy resort. For the price, I would expect the perfume to be more complex. But it is a nice scent--warm, fuzzy, clean, white flowers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1324278"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1324278#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1321677" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1321677" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emerson10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emerson10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALTAIA/Don-t-Cry-For-Me-32343.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32343.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Don't Cry For Me"title="Don't Cry For Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1321677ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1321677" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550">emerson10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-08">04/08/21 08:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This frag reminds me so much of Child. A very animalic and strong tuberose/jasmine combo. The smells is an uplifting one, but it feels like overdose of white floral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1321677"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1321677#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1312960" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
