padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1306805">enhade</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-24">03/24/21 00:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>i don't know how real lily smells, because i live in SEA. but i am pretty sure this is not jasmine scent like others say. probably tuberouse lily? compre to some other white floral scent this one has better projection although for longevity weak to moderate (3hr)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1312960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1312960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1312469" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1312469" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="severelain"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1056527"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1056527.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="severelain" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Memo-Paris/African-Leather-31383.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31383.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="African Leather"title="African Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1312469ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1312469" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1056527">severelain</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-23">03/23/21 06:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Every fragrance I try that supposedly showcases tuberose comes off so different that I'm left with no real sense of the note. Take something like Lys 41 and contrast it with say, Fire Island from Bond No 9. Other than the general white floral component, the commonalities end there. This is an enjoyably, almost aggressively calming fragrance composed with notes that are soft around the edges, all at the same pitch. Everything kind of touches your nose casually and at once, with each note reintroducing itself more intimately over the course of the wear. <br />
Masculine? Feminine? Ugh. I mean, who cares? This is a well-crafted though rather soft and oily composition, likely better suited for people with a dry complexion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1312469"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1312469#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1312367" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1312367" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ndrsncn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1230360"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ndrsncn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Les-Sables-Roses-55040.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55040.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Les Sables Roses"title="Les Sables Roses"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1312367ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1312367" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1230360">ndrsncn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-22">03/22/21 23:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>not just an usual white floral fragrance. it is very soft and delightful, so calming and won't make you cloying. I love it when I first try it, if you're fan of white floral and have enough budget, you better try this. despite the higher price, I found in the google that said LE LABO frags can last up to 50 years in correct storage area.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1312367"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1312367#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1304978" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1304978" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="moderndandy_swap"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289040"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1289040.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="moderndandy_swap" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1304978ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1304978" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1289040">moderndandy_swap</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-09">03/09/21 12:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>"This perfume reminds me of " is as bizzare as for any other famous white floral.<br />
<br />
This perfume reminds me Amouage Love Tuberose and Datura Noir, but its like a fresh 'diet' version of them. It doesn't have an overbearing cloying sweetness, and the way it is done is quite similar to Dior Addict.<br />
<br />
It is EXTREMELY persistent and powerful, keeps projecting through clothes, like its a smokeless bakhoor.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1304978"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1304978#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1297537" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1297537" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ouch!"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15485"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.15485.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ouch!" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Patchouly-3892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Patchouly"title="Patchouly"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1297537ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1297537" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/15485">Ouch!</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-23">02/23/21 14:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Here goes le labo again, naming their perfume after a note that doesn’t exist in the formula. This perfume is a smooth tuberose vanilla reminiscent of Amouage’s Love Tuberose. At a push I can smell a tiny breath of “other” white florals but they are a bit of a non descript mush swallowed up by the velvety creamy tuberose vanilla combo. This one is definitely not one of their best. And it could have been SO pretty. I’ll pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1297537"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1297537#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1288191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288191" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumesniffer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20321.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumesniffer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321">perfumesniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-06">02/06/21 14:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>lys 41 is tender white florals folded into whipped cream. <br />
<br />
the florals are a blend of airy tuberose, jasmine and maybe lily and/or orange blossom. lys 41 has an overall jasmine impression for me, but a clean jasmine, not indolic. it’s all very white, floaty &amp; sweetly innocent. kind of like if dior pure poison was made with better ingredients. I do really like it. it’s hard to get excited about le labo but lys 41 is well done. it’s the kind of sweet, clean white floral with vanilla that someone could spend half their life trying to find just this exact right thing. longevity and sillage are respectably moderate, too.<br />
<br />
UPDATE: coming back to say that lys 41 really IS that white floral rolled in vanilla that you’ve been looking for your whole life. the white florals are not screechy, and the dollop of vanilla whipped cream is the perfect portion. it’s floral but it’s delicious. most similar to annick goutal songes in edp. it really is just right. I love it 10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1288191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1288191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1263997" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1263997" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Julie_cutie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1283034"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Julie_cutie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1263997ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1263997" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1283034">Julie_cutie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-21">12/21/20 17:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first ever niche fragrance that I have owned. I'm so in love with the white flowers scents in this fragrance. It lasts whole day in my skin and the projection is around 3m.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1263997"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1263997#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1260713" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1260713" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hellojeannie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1279902"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hellojeannie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1260713ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1260713" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1279902">hellojeannie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-13">12/13/20 20:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I just love it. I got hooked as soon as I tested this without knowing the notes or anything. <br />
<br />
This smells like a big bouquet of white flowers with the perfect vanilla drydown. it's creamy, clean and cozy but very potent at the same time. with only one spray I can smell it all day, even too much for my liking, cause I usually wear soft perfumes. I love white flowers but for someome who's not a fan, I think it could smell somewhat screechy or tissue-like or even headache inducing especially at the first. but later it settles into soft creamy vanilla, so don't be afraid of trying it! And it's definitely not indolic or dirty in my opinion, it's very refined white floral actually.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1260713"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1260713#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1255398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1255398" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="danygurl06"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204896"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1204896.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="danygurl06" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lake-Skye/11-11-70646.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70646.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="11 11"title="11 11"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1255398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1255398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1204896">danygurl06</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-01">12/01/20 14:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Trying Lys 41 from my little dab sample smells oh so pretty. This is what I thought Cartier Baiser Vole would smell like. Cartier BV smells green, sour and creamy on my skin. <br />
<br />
Lys 41 is 2/3 soft white florals mixed with 1/3 creamy vanilla. Nothing is sharp. I can even smell the jasmine and it doesn’t turn air freshener on me at all. <br />
<br />
The vanilla on my skin smells like my memory of one of those sweet baby biscuits. So even though it’s sweet, it is not saccharine sweet. <br />
<br />
I can’t believe I’m saying this but I like Lys 41 more than Amouage Love Tuberose and Tom Ford Orchid Soleil. I can see myself wearing Lys 41 as an everyday fragrance. There is nothing that is “too much” about it. <br />
<br />
At first I thought it was going to be like Aerin Hibiscus Palm. Aerin HB starts off nice and then becomes too sweet and similar to tropical smelling cleaning products.<br />
<br />
I need to test this in a spray form before I commit to a bottle. If it still smells this good when spraying, I’m willing to buy the bottle and all of the accompanying toiletry items.<br />
<br />
Update: The dabber didn’t expose all of the facets of this fragrance. I bought the smallest bottle. It’s way stronger and sweeter.  I also get an almost sweet grape berry type smell in the far dry down. It’s very apparent on clothes/jackets more so than skin. It’s still a lovely fragrance, but is not what I’m looking for in a signature/everyday fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1255398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1255398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1217004" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1217004" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="appleorchard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/992400"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.992400.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="appleorchard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1217004ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1217004" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/992400">appleorchard</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-27">08/27/20 21:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like this. A big lily tuberose concoction, with vanilla. But there's also something weird and metallic. But it's nice.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1217004"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1217004#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1205215" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1205215" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rosemary14"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1146250"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1146250.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rosemary14" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sol-de-Janeiro/Cheirosa-59-88722.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88722.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cheirosa '59"title="Cheirosa '59"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1205215ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1205215" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1146250">Rosemary14</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-29">07/29/20 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I’m a liar. I went on a rant about Le Labo and how I find this house too trendy and expensive. In my defense I haven’t had too much success with the fragrances in this house but I really love this one. The comparisons to Carnal Flower-are correct but the other flowers in this really show through. Tuberose is prominent but also the lilies and jasmine. I think the vanilla is similar to the coconut in CF but it’s a little more rich instead of the natural coconut. All in all it’s a stunning white floral creamy fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1205215"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1205215#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1201507" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1201507" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pansylady"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.13903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pansylady" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aquolina/Sweet-Me-47047.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.47047.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sweet Me"title="Sweet Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1201507ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1201507" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/13903">pansylady</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-19">07/19/20 13:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance begins as a lovely but rather typical indolic lily/white flower powerhouse bouquet, but it quickly morphs into something I like even more- shifting and shimmering waves of incense, sunscreen, and play-doh~ and then all three of these accords merge into a gorgeous melange-</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1201507"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1201507#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1198776" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1198776" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="efi_iliop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179161"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1179161.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="efi_iliop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1198776ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1198776" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1179161">efi_iliop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-12">07/12/20 07:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like this perfume in its simplicity, just white flowers, no green or citrusy notes which is sometimes a good thing, great thing in this case (I have had Do Son, Carnal Flower, and Flowerhead in the past but prefer Lys 41). Having said that, it is quite heavy with great silage and longevity so one spray will do - can still smell it on my wrist after 12 hours having showered!<br />
<br />
(note: no sunscreen smell for me)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1198776"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1198776#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1195170" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1195170" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alJumar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173072"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173072.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alJumar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Metallique-55766.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55766.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Metallique"title="Metallique"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1195170ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1195170" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173072">alJumar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-07-02">07/02/20 09:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love at first sniff... soft creamy white floral... beautifully blended and very well balanced.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1195170"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1195170#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1190701" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1190701" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fleurdechair"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243601"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1243601.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fleurdechair" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lvnea/Eau-du-Diable-52456.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52456.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau du Diable"title="Eau du Diable"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1190701ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1190701" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1243601">fleurdechair</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-06-20">06/20/20 12:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my current favorite all-white floral. Beautiful, photorealistic, beautifully blended mix of jasmine, tuberose, and lily, grounded by vanilla and musk that add warmth and draw out the flowers' more animalic aspects. I am not getting any coconut or suntan lotion vibes at all. If I did, I wouldn't like it- "beach babe" might be the polar opposite of my vibes. I also found that it has huge sillage and excellent staying power.<br />
<br />
My sole caveat with this perfume is that, unfortunately, the other products in the Lys 41 line smell nothing like it. Having fallen deeply in love with the perfume, I went right back to the shop to consider a body lotion or perfume oil. None of them quite captured the magic of the perfume in those other formulations, all of which smell like a generic lily scent without the vanilla, musk, and floral complexity that makes this a winner.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1190701"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1190701#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1175255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1175255" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Doofie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223552"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Doofie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1175255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1175255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1223552">Doofie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-05-13">05/13/20 14:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my first encounter with tuberose and it made me realize I love the note. Have tried other such as Carnal Flower (lovely but a bit sharp on me) Moon Bloom (coconutty but very nice), Do son (to loud, nauseating almost), Twilly (good but not that much tuberose really..). I keep coming back to Lys 41 and I like that it’s a tuberose with something else. It also gives me a clean, freshly washed linen type of scent in the beginning and then it turns sweeter with more vanilla in the dry down. A clear tuberose but not to much, if that makes sense. Will probably have to get a bottle. Even though I don’t care much for the design and “lab feeling” from Le Labo, I do adore many of their fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1175255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1175255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1166430" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1166430" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mirrorghost"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/292309"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.292309.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mirrorghost" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rituals/Rituals-of-Dao-52636.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52636.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rituals of Dao"title="Rituals of Dao"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1166430ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1166430" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/292309">mirrorghost</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-21">04/21/20 17:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>wow this is gorgeous...it's tuberose and a hint of vanilla at first. just a stunning white floral. i smell something verrry slightly spicy in the back but it's very subtle. i think it's from the lily, which is so realistic because lilies seem to have that peppery thing going on as well. the lily gets creamier over time and i am getting a jasmine-lily combo after being on the skin longer, but then tuberose seems to come back, then fade and then come back stronger over time, then repeat that process. this is a white floral dream.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1166430"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1166430#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1161889" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1161889" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lavenderice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233183"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="lavenderice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1161889ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1161889" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233183">lavenderice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-08">04/08/20 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a sample vial of Lys 41 after smelling Le Labo's The Noir and loving it. <br />
When I spray this one on, all I can smell is sunscreen. It smells SO much like sunscreen to me. There are definitely floral undertones, and I smell vanilla on the dry down. But if I smelled this on someone without knowing what it is I would think they are just wearing a scented sunscreen/sun lotion. It also kind of smells like NARS Monoi Body Oil. <br />
That said, I do really enjoy the scent. It smells like a day at the beach! But I wouldn't buy a full, expensive bottle of it just to smell like sun lotion I can get at any store. I will use the rest of my sample vial though :) Maybe it will grow on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1161889"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1161889#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1148517" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1148517" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sleepy*weasel"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/849649"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.849649.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sleepy*weasel" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Eau-de-Givenchy-1966.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1966.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Eau de Givenchy"title="Eau de Givenchy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1148517ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1148517" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/849649">sleepy*weasel</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-23">02/23/20 06:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is to lily, as A La Nuit is to jasmine (and there is a decent jasmine note in this). It's strong but not screechy; indolic but balanced; unashamedly floral, but not powdery or old-fashioned. It runs a close second to Lys Mediterranee, and for those lily fans who don't get with the meaty salty vibe of that scent, this is your lily, and it lasts all day. I love it. It just shows how good modern scent can be, when people get it right. I have a FB, and I'm so happy with it x</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1148517"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1148517#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1139956" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1139956" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alanav09"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64428"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.64428.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="alanav09" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1139956ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1139956" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/64428">alanav09</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-01-30">01/30/20 20:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>wow, having read the reviews first, I expected this to be a lily explosion (and therefore was hesitant to try it as I kind of detest that scent, to be honest). boy am I glad I was wrong. this smells extremely clean, crisp, white, beachy, floral. smells like a jasmine bush, a dark night, cool breezes. sea salt, white sand, clear, warm water. <br />
<br />
I am in love. <br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
reminds me a bit of tom ford's Soleil Blanc, but with actual lasting power and much less coconut. this seduces. winks. flounces. flips her hair and says 'betcha didn't think a beachy scent could do THIS'.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1139956"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1139956#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1116360" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1116360" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dcjimr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1186069.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dcjimr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1116360ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1116360" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1186069">dcjimr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-16">11/16/19 15:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first 5 minutes of this were fantastically gorgeous, but when it started to dry down I got the same suntan lotion vibe that I got with the Neroli 36 dry down.  I ended up purchasing The Noir 29, which decidedly did not remind me of suntan lotion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1116360"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1116360#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1116135" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1116135" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Whit"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/57880"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.57880.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Whit" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1116135ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1116135" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/57880">Whit</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-15">11/15/19 22:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was another sample that I ordered directly from Le Labo. Looking at the notes, I was intrigued, but really didn't expect much, to be honest. Boy, was I wrong! This is a really beautiful white floral, that is sweet and creamy, without being dessert-like. <br />
<br />
I agree, the lily starts off a bit cold, but the other notes warm it up a bit and they blend nicely. This isn't really fresh on me, but rather strong and heady. There's a certain bit of tropical-ness to it, but I honestly think this could be worn in any season, day or night. I find it very sexy and hypnotizing as well; it's somewhat animalic on my skin too. <br />
<br />
Super long lasting with awesome sillage. This was an instant "love" for me as I've already placed an order for a bottle. Do try if you love white florals and if you don't, still try it. Very well done!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1116135"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1116135#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1112451" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1112451" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="addiehominem"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078812"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1078812.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="addiehominem" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tauer-Perfumes/02-L-Air-du-Desert-Marocain-4573.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4573.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="02 L'Air du Desert Marocain"title="02 L'Air du Desert Marocain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1112451ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1112451" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1078812">addiehominem</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-04">11/04/19 07:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of my favorite white florals. Lily is used BEAUTIFULLY here--it's a little cold and dessert levels of creamy, without being foody from the slight sweetness of tuberose and vanilla. A little tropical, a little Fracas va-va-voom. This perfume is a wonderful example of balance. I also think the longevity is great, as one full blast lasted the entire night on my skin, with something like ylang ylang and vanilla straying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Gorgeous creamy florals with some soft citrus that makes the skin smell warm, clean, and cozy.  Perfect for literally any occasion.   Beautiful perfume with moderate projection and solid longevity. Awesome Le Labo release! ❤️💕</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1107463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1107463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1106644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It does smell "creamy" and rich. After about 4 hours, it completely disappears on me.<br />
<br />
I find this VERY similar to Kate Spade's Live Colorfully (the original not the new Luxe version).<br />
<br />
EDIT: tried this again yesterday and the longevity was much longer. My husband REALLY liked this. Might give it a try for a while. Interested in how the Le Labo layering components are.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1106644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1106644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1088568" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
