Tuberose. Vanilla. I find this soft but long-lasting. It lasted me about 12 hours. If you like white florals this is a creamy, silky, sexy, vanilla tuberose/jasmine perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1088568"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1088568#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1081022" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1081022" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vixeyv"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/540576"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.540576.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vixeyv" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.18382.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lys 41"title="Lys 41"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1081022ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1081022" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/540576">vixeyv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-22">07/22/19 18:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My 6th sample of Le Labo!<br />
<br />
Wow it is so warm and beautiful, reminiscent of balmy, romantic spring and summer nights with jasmine in full bloom. It opens up with fresh summery frangipanis and warm jasmine. It's still very sunny in Sydney winter so I can enjoy the fantasy :P<br />
It then mellows down into a slightly creamy, banana, vanilla caramel, nice and warm.<br />
<br />
Very light, floral, yummy and pleasant. Like a good day at the beach with a light flaky cream pastry. Sounds like an odd combination of events, but if you let it, you'll really love it.<br />
<br />
This is one of my top favourites of Le Labo, including Rose (great on a man, delicious), Santal, Patchouli, Another and The Noir.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1081022"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1081022#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1075878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1075878" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="churinl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/731667"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.731667.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="churinl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-Dusita/Rosarine-80375.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80375.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rosarine"title="Rosarine"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1075878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1075878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/731667">churinl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-07-04">07/04/19 15:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received a sample of this from Luckyscent and I really liked, potentially love, this fragrance. I was surprised, as my chemistry can do funky things with lily (I'm talking about you, Cartier Baiser Voile). My ability to truly test this was compromised due to the size of the sample, but I am intrigued enough to seek out a larger decant, perhaps on Ebay, to further explore before I pull the costly trigger on this one!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1075878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1075878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1071592" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1071592" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cocofluff"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1141155.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="cocofluff" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Bendelirious-4511.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4511.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bendelirious"title="Bendelirious"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1071592ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1071592" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1141155">cocofluff</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-20">06/20/19 00:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>+ Gorgeous! Lys 41 is my new favorite! Very creamy and dense, no green at all if you're worried. <br />
<br />
Tuberose, Jasmine, Lily, and vanilla. Excellent quality. Not much skank (just a little musk). Just beauty. The only drawback is that it doesn't last, but neither does beauty. Smells like a vanilla ice-cream float and lilies. <br />
<br />
The drydown reminds me of Elie Saab Gardenia (definitely not the same, Saab Gardenia is much woodier and much less sweet). Both smell a little mushroomy on occasion, which I like. Lys 41 is sweeter and softer. They're different enough to own both IMO.<br />
<br />
Edit: I'm wearing Un Lys by Serge Lutens and it dawned on me that it smells similar to Lys 41! I love them both!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1071592"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1071592#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1069515" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1069515" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="christine Renee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/115124"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.115124.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="christine Renee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Auphorie/Ryukyu-53705.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53705.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ryukyu"title="Ryukyu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1069515ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1069515" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/115124">christine Renee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-06-12">06/12/19 11:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First time I tried this, got a “well, THAT’S strong” response from the man in my life. Tried it again today, and although yes, this is a powerful blast of white florals, it is very smooth and well-blended and quite lovely. As others have mentioned, there’s something beachy and tropical here, it makes me think of a bouquet of lily, jasmine, and tuberose floating in saltwater or a gorgeous suntanned girl wearing white flowers in her hair. Usually Le Labo fragrances disappear on my skin almost instantly but this one has better staying power, got several hours from it before it became a skin scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1069515"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1069515#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1063234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1063234" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ehsankasiri"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993871"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.993871.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ehsankasiri" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1063234ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1063234" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/993871">ehsankasiri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-23">05/23/19 06:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>شاهکار وایت فلورالی در اپنینگ<br />
عمق بسیار دلنشین<br />
به مرور شیرین و شیرینتر میشود و به سایر عطرهای وایت فلورالی به ویژه تیوبروزای میلر هریس شبیهتر<br />
-----------<br />
Scent &amp; Quality: 10/10<br />
Longevity: 9/10<br />
Sillage: 9/10<br />
Creativity &amp; Uniqueness: 9/10<br />
Affordability: 2/10<br />
-----------<br />
Overall: 7.8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1063234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1063234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1055410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1055410" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MannyOyson"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003632"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1003632.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MannyOyson" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Materi/Narcisse-Taiji-66396.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66396.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narcisse Taiji"title="Narcisse Taiji"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1055410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1055410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1003632">MannyOyson</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-29">04/29/19 01:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Like Byredo’s Flowerhead *without* the oppressingly sweet pineapple-cranberry note. Lys 41 is a milky, creamy, beautiful floral. And just as strong as Flowerhead. A gorgeous gorgeous creamy milk floral bouquet. (Caveat: Lys 41, 50ml is the same price for Flowerhead, 100ml.) Love it!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1055410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1055410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1047600" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1047600" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ralucucky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/38333"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.38333.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ralucucky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kenzo/Kenzo-Jungle-L-Elephant-70.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant"title="Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1047600ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1047600" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/38333">ralucucky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-04-03">04/03/19 14:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nice and sweet smell, but a bit old school. Really long lasting though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1047600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1047600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1044729" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1044729" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bubbles1964"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1095199.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bubbles1964" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bastide-Aix-en-Provence/Lavande-in-Love-62387.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62387.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lavande in Love"title="Lavande in Love"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1044729ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1044729" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1095199">Bubbles1964</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-03-25">03/25/19 19:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Confession. I’m a Le Labo fan. Much of what I have sampled I like or even love, but cost has prevented me from adding many to my collection. With this price range I’m selective, so even though I like Lys 41, it’s doubtful I’ll ever own a full bottle.<br />
<br />
So what about Lys 41. I would describe the opening and drydown as two different scents. On me it equal parts Lily and equal parts tuberose in the opening, and I love it. Very decadent and creamy. The drydown is all about the musk and cedar, with very light florals, it’s almost like two different scents in one.<br />
<br />
Currently I’m in Hawaii on vacation, and the opening really fits the vibe of Kauai. The drydown.....not so much but it’s still really pretty. Lys 41 feels like it has something else in it not listed, something more tropical like Ylang Ylang. It’s here with a light touch.<br />
<br />
Performance is average but my skin eats perfume. I have a couple of others that I’m saving up for, but this is a worthy consideration if you love big white, tropical leaning flower scents that turn to a cedar musk base.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1044729"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1044729#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1001810" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1001810" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BeguilingBeauty"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896839"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.896839.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BeguilingBeauty" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Trussardi/Trussardi-Donna-2011-13066.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13066.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Trussardi Donna (2011)"title="Trussardi Donna (2011)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1001810ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1001810" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/896839">BeguilingBeauty</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-17">11/17/18 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a couple samples and I'm wearing Lys 41 now and it's divine! I tried Carnal Flower a couple years ago and, on me, that was a bit stifling. I felt choked by tuberose. It was too intense. This has a very bold tuberose, but it's still pretty, and tropical, without crossing the border into overpowering. It pushes the envelope, but doesn't go over the line into smelling too pungent. On me, I really only am getting tuberose and vanilla in the background. And then it fades to a creamy, warm, tropical, yet clean vanilla. Very cozy and cuddly. I will have to wear it longer to see if I can discern other notes in there and I will update at that point. But so far so good. I hate the pricing of Le Labo. I get that they make great scents, but I do think it's a little ridiculous per ounce what they charge. If I end up getting this I'm going to get the smallest size probably. But it's just so pretty and feminine and bright that I think I will have to get it. On another note, the tuberose really reminds me of the Alba Botanica tuberose body wash. If anyone here has tried that, I feel like they smell a bit similar. I would be interested to see how this pairs with that. Maybe it'll amp up the tuberose too much but maybe it'll just add a nice layer to an already beautiful fragrance. Definitely try it. I got a few compliments so far.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1001810"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1001810#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent998732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc998732" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="p.t.h.l"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1092854"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1092854.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="p.t.h.l" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma998732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd998732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="998732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=998732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent988321" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc988321" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rosenoir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/988406"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="rosenoir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Artisan-Parfumeur/La-Chasse-aux-Papillons-1268.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1268.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Chasse aux Papillons"title="La Chasse aux Papillons"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma988321ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd988321" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/988406">rosenoir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-05">10/05/18 09:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A delicious strong floral musk vanilla that smells like a sun tan lotion!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="988321"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=988321#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18382" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc719176" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mhobba"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/875436"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="mhobba" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Narciso-Rodriguez/Narciso-Rodriguez-for-Him-Musk-6576.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6576.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Narciso Rodriguez for Him Musk"title="Narciso Rodriguez for Him Musk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma719176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd719176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/875436">mhobba</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-06-29">06/29/16 22:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Hi, my name is Michael and I love white flowers. I am a burly 6'3" man and I want to smell like Lys 41 every day. This is sweet, delicate and unmistakably feminine up front, but give it some time and you will meet the naughty side of these mischievous flowers soon enough.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="719176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=719176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1866848" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1866848" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hirotino"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1780277"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1780277.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hirotino" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1866848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1866848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1780277">hirotino</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-06-28">06/28/23 19:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I live in Hawaii and this one’s giving H A W A I I. White floral frags are very popular here but this is top notch among them. I just love it so much. I’m a guy but I enjoy wearing it a lot. Of course it is white floral, but on my skin it’s just this super clean scent. Who cares if it’s considered “feminine”. Flowers are for everybody✌︎</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1866848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1866848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2047176" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2047176" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="elclvna"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1714454"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1714454.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="elclvna" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Moth-and-Rabbit-Perfumes/Blow-Up-52812.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52812.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Blow Up"title="Blow Up"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2047176ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck8x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2047176" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1714454">elclvna</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-30">01/30/24 16:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>GOD. Actually getting teary-eyed at the prospect of reviewing this perfume but seeing as it's my absolute ride or die I feel as though I must. My mom wore La Chasse aux Papillons by L'Artisan Parfumeur when I was younger, and this scent reminds me of that one every time, even after years of wearing it. Tuberose is truly the goddess of all flowers. It's beautifully white and yellow and light and dark and nasty and sweet and harsh and totally chill like oh my God. Lys 41 smells like everything lovely and neutral and tragic about girlhood, like lying on your stomach on the floor kicking your feet in the air and writing in your diary while the breeze from the open window flutters the pages. Maybe you're writing about terrible things but the moment is calm and beautiful. Maybe you're still wearing somebody else's lipstick on your neck and wondering why you've never really liked roses, or a record is spinning on the turntable and you're sticky with the heat of dancing around the bedroom you've danced in your whole life. Not sure where I'm going with this. I love being a girl and I love my mom and I love tuberose. I love that there are so many ways to be a girl and to smell like a girl. Before I had a full sized bottle of this I would save my little sample to wear when I was going to see my girlfriend. I really love her a lot. There are so many things in this world that I love. Ok that's all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2047176"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2047176#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1367414" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1367414" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="butterbean"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.365534.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="butterbean" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Rose-Centifolia-Extrait-1-87535.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87535.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"title="Rose Centifolia Extrait 1"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1367414ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1367414" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/365534">butterbean</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-28">06/28/21 14:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is to DIE FOR.   I waited years to sample it, and finally ordered a sample from the company. Upon spraying 1 time.. eyes rolled back heavenly hypnotic beeeeauuutiful, and ordered a full bottle.<br />
<br />
I am soo happy to have this in my collection.  It is a TOP 5 contender for sure!  <br />
<br />
My favorite scents are tuberose, gardenia, lily and the more tropical, sweet kind of fleshy hypnotic heaven -- I am all in. <br />
<br />
<br />
Starts off with sweet lovely tropical tuberose, that becomes more creamy as the lily notes move forward.  <br />
<br />
The lily and tuberose blend soo amazingly well.   As it wears lily is more pronounced, and is super beautiful wafting trumpet/oriental lilies.   <br />
<br />
Nothing is indolic or heady here.  Highly recommend this one!<br />
<br />
<b>Lys 41 is just hands down GORGEOUS<b> 💕</b></b></p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1367414"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1367414#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1288191" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288191" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumesniffer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20321.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumesniffer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288191ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288191" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20321">perfumesniffer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-06">02/06/21 14:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>lys 41 is tender white florals folded into whipped cream. <br />
<br />
the florals are a blend of airy tuberose, jasmine and maybe lily and/or orange blossom. lys 41 has an overall jasmine impression for me, but a clean jasmine, not indolic. it’s all very white, floaty &amp; sweetly innocent. kind of like if dior pure poison was made with better ingredients. I do really like it. it’s hard to get excited about le labo but lys 41 is well done. it’s the kind of sweet, clean white floral with vanilla that someone could spend half their life trying to find just this exact right thing. longevity and sillage are respectably moderate, too.<br />
<br />
UPDATE: coming back to say that lys 41 really IS that white floral rolled in vanilla that you’ve been looking for your whole life. the white florals are not screechy, and the dollop of vanilla whipped cream is the perfect portion. it’s floral but it’s delicious. most similar to annick goutal songes in edp. it really is just right. I love it 10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1288191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1288191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18382" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>

Heady bouquet of white flowers, very feminine. The overall smell reminds me of some sunscreens and evokes coastal images. Strong sillage, a little too much for me. Make sure you sample before you buy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="831430"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=831430#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent838189" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc838189" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="erikamcs68"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070392"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="erikamcs68" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mizensir/White-Neroli-39214.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39214.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="White Neroli"title="White Neroli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma838189ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd838189" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1070392">erikamcs68</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-07-04">07/04/17 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells just like an old perfume extract forgotten for years in the closet; as l already told, fragrances are very personal and for me Lys 41 is a no-go; it is a such strong sillage l could even taste it after minutes l applied the scent on my skin.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="838189"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=838189#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1468838" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1468838" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="evarosa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266133"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1266133.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="evarosa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Iris-Perle-48539.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48539.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Iris Perle"title="Iris Perle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1468838ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1468838" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1266133">evarosa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-23">12/23/21 03:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful soft and beachy white flowers in the opening. Unfortunately the drydown does not work for me, it is sort of sweaty (vetiver?) and green.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="1468838"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=1468838#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2290794" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2290794" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pauldlc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1265522"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pauldlc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2290794ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2290794" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); For this I no longer buy Le Labo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="18382"comment_id="2290794"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Le-Labo/Lys-41-18382.html?ccid=2290794#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="18382" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

            <a href="https://www.fragrantica.com/designers/Givenchy.html" class="en2inter">Givenchy</a>
        </span>
    </div>
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">
        <span style="white-space: nowrap; color: lightsteelblue">20.&nbsp;</span>
        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

        </span>
    </div>
            </div>
        <div class="cell small-4 medium-2 flex-container flex-dir-column">
            <div style="display: flex; align-items: start; text-align: start; line-height: 1.2em; height: 1.7em; overflow: hidden;">

        <span style="display: -webkit-box; -webkit-line-clamp: 1; -webkit-box-orient: vertical; overflow: hidden; text-overflow: ellipsis;">

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });

</script>
